call_info.topic_description:
Expected Impact:

For the general public: the objective is to raise public awareness of the results of Cohesion policy and their impact on citizens' lives to Europeans who are unaware of the EU and of the EU action in their region. Information should focus on developing greater understanding of the contribution of Cohesion policy to boosting jobs and growth in Europe and reducing disparities among Member States and regions.

For stakeholders: the objective is to engage with stakeholders (including national, regional and local authorities, beneficiaries, businesses, academia) to further communicate the impact of Cohesion policy on their regions and to feed into the discussion on the future of Cohesion policy and, more broadly, the future of Europe.

Expected Outcome:

The expected results and outputs are the following:

  • to increase media coverage on Cohesion policy, in particular at regional and local level;
  • to enhance people's awareness of the results of Cohesion policy and their impact on their lives;
  • to achieve concrete outputs and deliverables aimed at wide outreach within the measure's duration – e.g. TV and radio broadcast, online or print coverage, other type of information measures and dissemination - taking multilingualism into account.
Objective:

The main aim of the call is to provide support for the production and dissemination of information and content linked to EU Cohesion policy, including inter alia the Just Transition Fund, or relevant support from the Technical Support Instrument.

The proposals should provide coherent, objective and comprehensive information, in order to give an accurate overall picture of the EU Cohesion policy. The proposals should illustrate and assess the role of Cohesion policy in delivering the EU’s political priorities , such us the transition to a greener more digital economy, development of strategic technologies, housing or the demographic transition and the right to stay, and in addressing current and future challenges for the EU, its Member States, its regions and the local level.

Scope:

The information measures should include one or several activities such as:

  • production and distribution of print, multimedia or audiovisual material
  • web and social media outreach activities
  • media events
  • conferences, seminars, workshops.

projects.TITLE: Media Partnerships for Promoting EU Cohesion Policy
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
“MEDIA4COHESION” is an information measure to produce and disseminate information on the overall EU Cohesion policy in both Belgium and Italy, with special attention to the new instruments of 2021–27 programming and the synergies between regional funds and the National Recovery Plan.
The action aims to address major awareness gaps among Belgians and Italians concerning Cohesion and related issues: a general, significant lack of recognition of policy benefits; Dramatically low levels of understanding and appreciation of the policy among young generations.
The Consortium of “MEDIA4COHESION” proposes a multilevel and multi-targeted information measure with a special focus on the impact and results of Cohesion policy. The action leverages diverse layers of communication to inform, raise awareness, and encourage participation by stakeholders, media professionals, and citizens—especially young ones.The information measure includes: A dedicated two-tiered newsfeed delivered to local and national media and directly to citizens;Online and in-person events with stakeholders’ participation and field experts; Multimedia news coverage and successful stories on how EU Cohesion funds were used in Belgium and Italy; A specific activity targeting 2–3 high schools completes the action framework.

Participants.Organization Name: AGENZIA ANSA - AGENZIA NAZIONALE STAMPA ASSOCIATA - SOCIETA COOPERATIVA

projects.TITLE: CohesionCha(lle)nge: Change Perspectives, Embrace New Challenges
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
The CohesionCha(lle)nge project is an ambitious and forward-thinking communication campaign designed to address a critical information gap surrounding EU Cohesion Policy, particularly at the regional level. It is coordinated by Editoriale Nazionale S.r.l., one of Italy’s leading media groups, the project capitalizes on its extensive expertise in journalism and digital media to ensure the effective dissemination of information. The project’s name encapsulates the dual focus of the initiative: the challenge of making Cohesion Policy tangible and relevant to both the general public and young people, and the change it seeks to inspire by showcasing the policy's transformative impact on communities across Europe. In this regard, its background and rationale stem from the need to address critical gaps in public awareness, as evidenced by the latest Eurobarometer surveys, which reveal that many Europeans—particularly young people—are unaware of EU-funded projects in their regions and the tangible benefits of Cohesion Policy. The project will also focus on two key aspects of Cohesion Policy’s impact: its role in fostering economic development by building productive districts in less developed regions and its contribution to education and training, which strengthens human capital—a crucial driver of regional and national growth. By showcasing these dimensions, the project aims to connect policy goals to real-world benefits, making the policy’s relevance and transformative potential clear to diverse audiences.
The project aims to demystify Cohesion Policy, by employing dynamic storytelling, cutting-edge communication tools, and fostering collaborative dialogue to bridge the disconnect between policy and citizens’ daily lives. This way the project ensures broad outreach and engagement and that the policy is not only well-understood by the European citizens and stakeholders but also appreciated for its evolving role in addressing current and future challenges across the EU.  Th
Keywords: Communication on Cohesion Policies - MEDIA Project

projects.TITLE: Cohesion heroes: Best practice and perspectives from Romania
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
„Cohesion heroes: Best practice and perspectives from Romania” is proposed by G4Media, a top online quality news outlet in Romania and Europuls, a top EU policies think-tank activating in Romania and Brussels.
Ever since its accession in 2007, Romania has been a net beneficiary of the EU cohesion funds. The country received EUR 89.4 billion in EU funds since 2007 and the net flow balance has exceeded EUR 60 billion.
While these facts represent an undisputed argument of the benefits that the cohesion policy brought to the economic progress of Romania since its accession, not all the Romanians are aware of the positive effects. 
Throughout the project proposed, COHERO4EU we aim to first, transparently inform the Romanian general and specific target audiences about the benefits of the EU cohesion policy and second, to  increase the awareness of European funds impact. These objectives will be achieved through a series of activities: video and written content that highlight the impact in local communities, at grassroot level, of European cohesion funds, testimonials from the beneficiaries; general public and specialized public engagement, local and international events; public opinion survey and social media quizzes.
We aim to publish over 280 pieces of content, over 580 posts on various social media channels and to get to an estimated reach of 680.000 on social media platforms.  
For direct interaction and engagement with the target groups we will organize 5 offline events: local, national and international, with an estimated number of at least 310 physical participants in total.
In terms of sustainability, the content published in the specially created sections on the websites of G4Media and Europuls websites, will remain after the end of the project and they can be accessed without time limit. Both partners will include constantly, on the long term, updates on Cohesion Policy topics in order to keep the Cohesion Policy and its future development on public agenda.

Participants.Organization Name: ASOCIATIA GROUP 4 MEDIA FREEDOM AND DEMOCRACY

projects.TITLE: Advancing EU cohesion coverage across South-East Europe
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
CohesionEUSEE focuses on the journalistic coverage of EU cohesion policy in South-East Europe, with particular emphasis on Bulgaria, Croatia, Greece, Italy, and Romania. 
Despite being major recipients of cohesion funds, these countries often experience underreporting or misrepresentation of cohesion initiatives. The project aims to bridge this gap by providing in-depth, multi-perspective and multilingual journalistic coverage of regional policy. The consortium, comprising five media outlets with strong expertise on EU affairs, will offer comprehensive analyses combining local, national, and transnational perspectives. This will highlight shared challenges such as regional disparities, demographic shifts, and governance quality, allowing for comparisons of cohesion measures across multiple territories. Partners will assess current and past cohesion projects, identify factors limiting their success, and offer insights into how these challenges can be overcome. Journalistic coverage will focus on social development, environmental issues, youth opportunities, transport, urban challenges and cross-border collaboration, explaining how cohesion measures address these issues. A dedicated workstream (WP4) will ensure the engagement of various stakeholders in each country, including entrepreneurs interested in EU funding. The project will also cover the ongoing debate about the future of cohesion policy, especially with regard to the evolving Multiannual Financial Framework and EU enlargement, with a focus on how these issues affect South-East Europe. 
At least 273 editorial outputs will be produced, including articles, podcasts, videos, and social media content, targeting diverse audiences.Content will be shared across various platforms, including websites, newsletters, and social media. Field reporting and multilingual coverage will ensure a localized and broad-reaching understanding of the region’s cohesion measures, enhancing EU citizens’ engagement with the policy.

Participants.Organization Name: ANEXARTITA MESA MAZIKIS ENIMEROSIS ANONYMI ETAIREIA

projects.TITLE: Cohesion Policy: The Path to Balanced Development of Latvia
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
The project ‘Cohesion Policy: The Path to Balanced Development of Latvia’ introduces a comprehensive approach to raising awareness and understanding of the EU Cohesion Policy framework and its outcomes among diverse stakeholders and the general public in Latvia. By combining digital and in-person activities, it seeks to engage policymakers, public authorities at all levels, NGOs, educational and scientific institutions, municipal organizations, business representatives, youth, and other social groups.
Focusing on the current programming period, the project highlights the significance of key Cohesion Policy Funds in Latvia, including the Cohesion Fund, European Regional Development Fund, European Social Fund Plus, and Just Transition Fund. It also explores the alignment of investments in Latvia with the five priorities of the Cohesion Policy: fostering a competitive and smarter Europe, advancing a greener and more sustainable Europe, improving connectivity, promoting social inclusion, and bringing Europe closer to citizens. Additionally, the project evaluates the effectiveness and sustainability of fund allocations at national, regional, and local levels.
The project delivers its messages through content published in Latvian and Russian (languages extensively used in Latvia), encompassing articles, videos, podcasts, and studio discussions shared on prominent platforms such as TVNET.lv, RUS.TVNET.lv, and Apollo.lv. It includes promotional campaigns across news media, social media, and Google platforms, alongside events tailored for business representatives and the public. Gamified engagement activities and interviews with key stakeholders further enrich the initiative’s reach and depth.
By leveraging these efforts, the project aims to foster dialogue in between public authorities and general society, complement communication efforts, enhance understanding, and demonstrate the strategic benefits of the Cohesion Policy for Latvia’s balanced and sustainable development.

projects.TITLE: NEXT-EU - Networking, Education, and Transformation for the Next Chapter of the EU
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective: The project aims to support the European Union's objectives related to achieving climate neutrality by 2050, through education and informing citizens about energy transformation, EU policies, and their impact on daily life. The project focuses on countering disinformation about climate change and energy, offering reliable, fact-based information on EU actions and strategies. The goal is to reach a broad audience, particularly younger users and people from rural areas, through interactive and engaging forms of communication, such as surveys, debates, expert interviews, quizzes, and multimedia content. The project will utilize the WP portal and the Vibez platform to reach various demographic groups, including individuals aged 15-29. In addition to issues related to energy transformation, the project will also promote awareness about financial support from EU funds, particularly in the context of sustainable development and social justice. Expected outcomes include reaching 3.8 million unique users, generating over 4.3 million views of materials, and 6.5 million video plays on websites and social media channels. The project will contribute to a better understanding of EU climate and energy policies and enable citizens to actively participate in the transformation process.

projects.TITLE: Cohesion Stories: Impact of European Cohesion Funds on Youth and Disability in Spain
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
"The ""Cohesion Stories"" project aims to effectively communicate the impact of EU Cohesion Policy by showcasing real-life examples of its benefits for individuals and communities in Spain, particularly targeting youth, persons with disabilities, and other vulnerable groups. Over 12 months, the project will produce 11 live television programs, supported by a comprehensive multimedia strategy. These programs will highlight success stories from entities and regions that have implemented EU-funded initiatives, demonstrating the tangible outcomes of cohesion funds and their contributions to local development.
To ensure accessibility and inclusivity, the project will utilize live broadcasts, podcasts, and news and social media campaigns, all adhering to accessibility standards with subtitles, sign language, and user-friendly formats. Dynamic content on platforms like TikTok and Instagram will engage younger audiences, while tailored narratives will address the experiences and needs of vulnerable groups.
Associated partners, including social organizations and local governments that have implemented impactful projects funded by EU Cohesion Policy, such as the European Social Fund Plus (ESF+), will share firsthand experiences of how cohesion funds address societal challenges and drive change. Their contributions will enhance the credibility of narratives and extend the project's reach through their networks.
The project aims to raise awareness of EU Cohesion Policy’s real-world impact, foster understanding of its role in inclusive social and regional development, and encourage active participation in EU initiatives. By bridging the gap between policy and citizens through accessible storytelling, the project will inspire trust in EU policies and empower individuals and organizations to engage with cohesion funds."
Keywords: Cohesion stories; European Funds; Youth; Disability; Vulnerabe groups; Spain; Impact; Inclusion; Transformation

projects.TITLE: Putting Europeans at the heart of Cohesion
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
•	Objective
The project aims to contribute to a better understanding of the EU Cohesion policy by European citizens thanks to a verified, neutral, transmedia and multilingual information campaign.
•	Activities carried out by France Médias Monde and its affiliated entity RFI România:
1-	the production of dedicated media content broadcast on well identified programs on our TV, radio and social media channels based on concrete examples of projects funded by the EU Cohesion policy in over 15 EU countries and outermost regions. 
2-	the organization of « in-real-life » events in direct contact with the European public as well as an online contest to boost interaction with our audience and increase their involvement in the implementation and evaluation of the Cohesion policy. 

•	Type and number of persons benefiting from the project
EU citizens of all ages, those already interested in the EU Cohesion policy as well as those that are unaware of it. It will specifically target:
-	our European broadcast audience: At least 2.303 M Europeans reached by the first broadcast of the project’s productions
-	our European digital audience:
-> At least 41,681 monthly European visitors of the webpages publishing the projects content
-> An average of 57.66 M monthly video views on YouTube coming from EU countries and the 1.675 M European Facebook and Instagram followers potentially exposed to the project’s content
-	480 Europeans interacting and participating in the project

•	Type and number of outputs/deliverables to be produced
A total of 120 TV, radio and multimedia online content produced in French, English, Portuguese and Romanian broadcast on air and published online by the end of August 2026.

•	Number of broadcasts, rebroadcasts and airtime covered by the project
A total of 127 broadcasts (including rebroadcasts) of our TV and radio productions about the Cohesion policy on our media channels representing 2,438 minutes of broadcast (rebroadcasting included).

projects.TITLE: Regions without borders
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)

projects.TITLE: Sustainable Mobility for All / Dostopnost za prihodnost
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
RTV Slovenija's Sustainable Mobility for All project is a broadcasting cross-media initiative addressing accessibility for all citizens, focusing on mobility, public transport, sustainability, and urban-rural development. It explores intelligent public transport, European rail corridors to reduce carbon footprints, and the transfer of best practices to Slovenia, emphasizing investments in the green transition through cohesion policy. The project includes analytical research in 14 European countries comparing and testing the possibility of implementing present solutions to Slovenian practices, combining all platforms of national public broadcaster: radio, TV, web, social media, and live events.
The proposed project embraces 10 comprehensive TV broadcasts, 47 radio broadcasts on national and regional Radio Slovenija channels, 2 all-day on-location programmes, and public debates featuring youth perspectives on cohesion-funded sites. Broadcasters for minorities from Italy, Austria and Hungary will also air the content. We will offer the content to the EBU News Exchange, as well. Flashmob events for public transport users will offer creative insights into mobility. Online content comprises features on 10 cycling routes with interactive maps hosted on a special project website and youth-focused platforms. 
Podcasts with a broad reach and high-performing social media profiles will amplify dissemination. Accessible technologies like subtitles and sign language will ensure inclusivity. All content produced to the highest media standards will also be available after the end of the project.
The project aims to reach a large part of the population through a wide range of media, fostering a positive perception of sustainable mobility, aligning with EU priorities, as well as inspiring local communities and committing policymakers to action.

projects.TITLE: Local Connections for European Cohesion
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
The project seeks to enhance awareness of the European Cohesion Policy across three key Spanish regions—Andalusia, Catalonia, and Galicia—through the implementation of a regional communication strategy. This strategy comprises:

• A radio campaign featuring 90 episodes, each 30 minutes long, on European Cohesion Policy. These episodes, produced in Spanish, Catalan, and Galician, will be broadcast on 128 local radio stations, reaching 264 municipalities in the three regions and a combined audience exceeding 2.2 million people. The campaign will focus on two primary themes: the role of Cohesion Policy in fostering jobs and growth in Europe, and its contribution to reducing disparities among Member States and regions.

• Multimedia productions, including 15 videos (Reels / Short) for social network highlighting emblematic projects funded by Cohesion Policy in these regions. These videos will be integrated into a broader online communication effort, complemented by 30 professional video about Cohesion policy, 90 brief audio podcasts, and 30 up-to-date news pieces about the European Cohesion Policy's regional impact.

• Three regional radio conferences, which will serve as platforms for debate and reflection on the goals, achievements, and future of Cohesion Policy. These events will feature international experts and draw at least 120 participants, primarily journalists. The conferences will be recorded and later aired on the project's radio network.

This multifaceted approach ensures wide-reaching and impactful dissemination of the European Cohesion Policy’s benefits and objectives.

projects.TITLE: Our Neighborhood, Our Europe: How EU Policies Affect Us
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective: The proposed project focuses on raising awareness of the EU's cohesion policy in the Czech Republic, particularly in structurally disadvantaged regions like Moravskoslezský, Ústecký, and Karlovarský. These regions face significant economic and social challenges, necessitating targeted communication about the benefits of EU-funded projects. Previous research shows that knowledge of local projects enhances positive perceptions of the EU; while 92% of respondents are aware of EU funds, awareness is lower in these regions (e.g., 89% in NUTS II Northwest).The project aims to produce and distribute multimedia and audiovisual materials that provide comprehensive information on the outcomes of the cohesion policy and its impact on citizens. We will use social media to facilitate open discussions about regional needs and current topics, directly addressing the call's goals of increasing awareness about cohesion policy and the Just Transition Fund.Our objectives include enhancing media coverage of the cohesion policy and increasing awareness of the benefits these projects bring. We plan to execute 24 reports on regional television, 18 press articles in the national newspaper Blesk, and radio segments on Frekvence 1. Additionally, we will collaborate with influencers, run a social media campaign, and organize press conferences and outdoor campaigns to maximize outreach.To engage younger generations, we will leverage social media and the high internet penetration rate (84% among those aged 15 and older) to disseminate information effectively. Research indicates that familiarity with specific EU-funded projects leads to more positive evaluations of their impact (positive ratings drop nearly one-third without such knowledge).Overall, this project will provide clear information about the EU's cohesion policy, promote awareness of specific regional projects, and improve perceptions of EU funds, ultimately strengthening citizens' trust in the EU and its benefits for loc. communities

projects.TITLE: Cohesion for Innovation, Transition, and Tackling Demographic Downturn: Showcasing how cohesion policy supports local growth, tackles demographic decline, and promotes the digital and ecological trans
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective: The project is a dynamic and ambitious initiative, carefully designed to bring the transformative power of the EU Cohesion Policy closer to citizens and stakeholders while fostering collaboration and innovation across regions. Its framework is built upon five interconnected work packages, each with a clear purpose and a focus on delivering impactful results. The project relies on 5 main actions aimed at increasing awareness and engagement of Italian citizens in cohesion policy by promoting editorial content on regional policy initiatives and flagship projects that are expected to generate over 2.5 mln. Moreover, a wide range of stakeholders will be directly involved as experts and testimonials in the production of information as well as in interactive events planned to increase the understanding of the cohesion policy relevance for local territories and promote capacity building and cross-sectorial and cross-regional partnerships. The action will focus on key topics of the cohesion policy, namely the ecological and digital transition, the demographic transition, social inclusion and innovation as a driver to address these challenges. The action is structured in five synergistic Work Packages (WPs) to enhance public understanding, engagement, and dissemination of the EU Cohesion Policy while fostering collaboration. WP1 ensures effective management and high-quality outputs. WP2 delivers accessible information through newsletters, articles, podcasts, and docuseries. WP3 showcases Puglia’s regional successes. WP4 promotes collaboration via events and labs. WP5 ensures widespread dissemination and sustainability through digital platforms, a forum, and a Manifesto for Cohesion.

Participants.Organization Name: Camera di commercio industria artigianato e agricoltura di Brindisi - Taranto

projects.TITLE: Cohesion Shapes the Future
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective: "Cohesion Shapes the Future aims to address some priorities of the new European Commission, highlighted in the political guidelines published in July 2024. In particular, our aim is to stimulate discussion on issues that are intertwined with Cohesion Policy. The Structural Funds already invest considerable resources in the competitiveness of the European economic system, both to strengthen businesses and to strengthen infrastructure. Competitiveness – also in light of the Draghi plan – has become one of the drivers of EU policies. Cohesion policy will also be asked to contribute to this collective effort. Among the political objectives of the new commission on which we would like to keep the attention high are two issues related to the European social model that ""does not want to leave anyone behind"". First of all, we are referring to the demographic changes that the Member States are experiencing, with serious social and economic consequences for families, businesses and governments. Linked to demographic changes is the phenomenon of gentrification of cities, which generates housing crises and excludes the youngest and economically weaker sections of the population. Finally, the two-year period 2025-2026 will be decisive in shaping the new post-2027 Multiannual Financial Framework. The change of strategy that is expected – resources in exchange for reforms, as for the RRF – will require a lot of media attention on the consequences that this may have on Cohesion policy in general."
Keywords: Cohesion; Demography; Competitiveness; Housing; Regions; Italy

projects.TITLE: INTERregional ACTion for Italy & France
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
The INTERACTIF project is a pilot communication campaign aimed at raising awareness and engaging local communities with the European Union’s cohesion policy, focusing on two cross-border regions: Piedmont (Italy) and Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes (France). These areas, while rich in potential, face challenges such as geographical isolation and depopulation.

The project primarily targets young people (aged 16-35), who are seen as both observers of local challenges and agents of change. By involving youth, INTERACTIF seeks to create new narratives highlighting the potential of cross-border regions and leveraging their ability to amplify messages through social networks and digital platforms.

To achieve its goals, INTERACTIF actively involves media outlets, local authorities, universities, and civil society organizations, fostering collaborations and synergies. It uses innovative and creative tools, such as digital storytelling, partnerships with influencers, and informal approaches (e.g., memes), to make communication accessible and engaging. Young people thus become ambassadors of cross-border cooperation, enhancing the dissemination of information about cohesion policy.

The project’s strength lies in the expertise of its Franco-Italian team, experienced in communication and public engagement. This expertise ensures the development of targeted and effective activities, delivering measurable results. The project also emphasizes long-term impact by inspiring similar initiatives in other European regions, contributing to a more unified and engaged Europe through better communication and cross-border collaboration. 

In summary, INTERACTIF provides an innovative and scalable model for improving communication about cohesion policy in cross-border regions, promoting civic engagement, cooperation, and a shared European identity. With the potential to inspire similar initiatives, the project contributes to a more inclusive and youth-oriented communication strategy.
Keywords: Cohesion Policy; Cross-border Regions; Youth Engagement; Multilinguism; Civic Engagement; European Identity; Local Collaboration; Transnational

Participants.Organization Name: COOPERATIVA CULTURA E COMUNICAZIONI SOCIALI SIGLABILE COOPERATIVA CCS

projects.TITLE: [One Cohesion Policy: Multiple Regions in Sync for a Just Transition]
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
"The project ""One Cohesion Policy: Multiple Regions in Sync for a Just Transition"" (2024 – BG - COREJIO) aims to enhance public understanding and awareness of the EU Cohesion Policy's mission and principles, focusing on Bulgaria's coal-transition regions—Stara Zagora, Pernik, and Kyustendil. The initiative addresses significant gaps in communication by countering misinformation, fostering trust, and emphasizing the transformative role of the Cohesion Policy in regional development. It proposes a comprehensive strategy involving innovative communication methods, stakeholder engagement, and capacity building for media professionals.

Key project objectives include raising public awareness of the Policy's contributions to sustainable development, empowering media and communication managers to act as credible amplifiers of EU initiatives, and fostering active stakeholder dialogue. Activities will leverage tools such as video storytelling, interactive media platforms, podcasts, and tailored workshops to engage diverse audiences effectively. The project also incorporates a robust dissemination plan to ensure long-term impact, including the creation of a digital compendium of best practices and a dedicated web platform.

With partners including the Stara Zagora Regional Economic Development Agency (SZ REDA), Brand Media Bulgaria, and Television Stara Zagora, the project will directly reach over 150,000 citizens, train 50 stakeholders, and deliver high-quality multimedia content. This initiative not only aligns with EU priorities for just transitions but also serves as a replicable model for other regions undergoing significant socio-economic transformations."

projects.TITLE: Europe Closer to Home: Bridging EU Cohesion Policy and Czech Communities
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
"The "" Europe Closer to Home "" is a project driven by Vltava Labe Media (VLM) to amplify awareness of EU-funded initiatives and their tangible benefits for citizens. Harnessing its extensive reach and expertise as one of the Czech Republic’s leading media houses, VLM employs a multi-channel strategy to ensure impactful communication and engagement.

Key activities include regular articals in Deník Extra, a free newspaper distributed to 1.7 million households, and in Deník, a paid daily newspaper with broad state and regional coverage with readership of 1.9 million readers (officially measured in Q3/24). These publications will feature targeted content on EU-supported projects, emphasizing their role in fostering regional development and improving community quality of life.

Complementing the print strategy, VLM intensifies its online reach through denik.cz, one of the country’s top online news platforms with over 4 million real monthly users. Weekly digital articles and multimedia content, including photos and videos, will spotlight EU contributions, catering to regional preferences and themes.

Additionally, the initiative reinforces community engagement through educational outreach. Capitalizing on VLM's collaborations with leading Czech universities, the project incorporates a series of lectures and workshops devoted to EU-related topics. These sessions aim to engage students and young professionals, fostering informed discussions and deeper understanding.
Through these focused actions, the ""Europe Closer to Home"" seeks to bridge the information gap, combat misinformation, and inspire public trust in EU policies. By leveraging both traditional and digital media alongside academic forums, the project creates a well-rounded approach to enhancing public awareness and appreciation of EU contributions.
"

projects.TITLE: EUconomy – Partnerships4Prosperity
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective: "The ""EUconomy – Partnerships4Prosperity"" project underscores the vital role of EU cohesion policy in fostering economic development and promoting social inclusion. By focusing on concrete, cross-border initiatives, the project highlights how European integration benefits local communities while strengthening democratic values. By investing in structurally weak regions, cohesion policy not only promotes economic participation but also enhances trust in democratic processes. Through authentic storytelling and accessible content, our initiative brings these benefits to life. Each of the ten planned content packages includes a video, a concise article providing detailed insights, and three targeted social media posts. These are crafted with authenticity, featuring interviews with individuals affected by or involved in the projects, and are complemented by infographics and animations. Thematically, the project covers diverse areas such as sustainability, innovation, vocational training, and digital transformation. It spans regions in Germany and neighbouring countries like Austria, Poland, the Czech Republic, Denmark, and France, showcasing both completed and ongoing initiatives. This approach ensures a comprehensive understanding of the EU's role in fostering regional development. Social media is a cornerstone of the project’s outreach strategy. By employing short, engaging video snippets and visually appealing formats, the initiative effectively reaches younger audiences, making the complex topic of cohesion policy more relatable and accessible. We utilize the services of dpa's division news aktuell, including dissemination via ots and presseportal. These tools, combined with partnerships with European news agencies, enable us to achieve significant reach and impact. To conclude the project, a hybrid press event will be held in Berlin and streamed online. This event will highlight the project’s achievements, featuring a panel discussion."

Participants.Organization Name: DPA DEUTSCHE PRESSE AGENTUR GESELLSCHAFT MIT BESCHRANKTER HAFTUNG

projects.TITLE: Youth4EU - Large-scale events and youth volunteering for cohesion policy awareness raising
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
The Youth4EU project fosters public awareness of the EU Cohesion Policy through the implementation of local, grassroot reach out actions, from a 1000 network of full time youth EU mobility volunteers,  as well as existing and foreplaned major national and international events, enabling to pass a message therefore countering rising Euroscepticism, raising awareness of the benefits and functioning of the Cohesion Policy, and fostering greater trust and engagement among citizens.

The initiative led by the Collective for a European Civic Service in a consortium of five countries/6 partners will include two main pillars of action:

First, the consortium will enhance the visibility of the Cohesion Policy through its direct implication in major national events (Berlin Conference, Karpacz Economic Forum, Lust In Sarreguemines Franco-German festival, Youth Peace Forum during Milano Olympic Games). These gatherings will feature the partners and European Civic Service volunteers who will animate dedicated spaces for discussions and presentations, alongside influential stakeholders such as regional decision- makers and policymakers. Professional media coverage will amplify the outreach, ensuring the message resonates beyond the immediate event context.

Second, the project will deploy grassroots communication strategies to engage the public directly. Teams of young European volunteers from our consortium of youth organisations, trained as “changemakers,” will organize monthly public sessions across France, Germany, Italy, and Poland – representing a total of at-least 100 workshops. These activities will highlight the tangible impacts of EU-funded projects towards those underserved communities. By empowering these volunteers as ambassadors for EU policies, the initiative aims to inspire a new generation of Europeans to appreciate and advocate for the benefits of the Cohesion Policy and make them long term sustainable relays.

Participants.Organization Name: COLLECTIF POUR UN SERVICE CIVIQUE EUROPEEN

projects.TITLE: Signs of Cohesion Policy in Cyprus, Bulgaria, and Romania
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
Our project aims to raise awareness in three different Member States (i.e. Cyprus, Bulgaria and Romania) about Cohesion Policy and its funds as well as projects funded in the countries involved and the impact that such projects had on the improvement of citizens' everyday lives. Alongside, the project team aspires to inform people about the fact that Cohesion Policy contributes to the promotion of a more inclusive, sustainable, green, connected and closer to the citizens European Union. Additionally, during the project implementation, a set of activities to be implemented aim to bring together not only relevant stakeholders at local, regional, national and EU levels but also academia, businesses and citizens to discuss about the Cohesion Policy's future.

To this end, a comprehensive awareness raising campaign will be implemented through the use of new and traditional media as well as the
organisation of a set of different events. Thus, throughout the project lifespan, various content will be produced and distributed such as: a web-tv show, online publications, posters, and social media posts. The goal of the campaign will be to inform people about
Cohesion Policy's crucial role in the improvement of EU citizens lives without leaving anyone and any region behind. Additionally, a series of events (i.e. focus groups, open discussions) will be implemented in order for the project to engage with both relevant stakeholders and people and make them participate in a discussion on Cohesion Policy and its future. Last but not least, the Cohesion Policy will be promoted through gamified experiences.

call_info.topic_description:
Expected Impact:

For the general public: increased public awareness of the results of Cohesion policy and their impact on citizens' lives to Europeans who are unaware of the EU and of the EU action in their region. Information should focus on developing greater understanding of the contribution of Cohesion policy to boosting jobs and growth in Europe and reducing disparities among Member States and regions.

For stakeholders: enhanced stakeholders' engagement (including national, regional and local authorities, beneficiaries, businesses, academia) enabling them to further communicate the impact of Cohesion policy on their regions and to feed into the discussion on the future of Cohesion policy and, more broadly, the future of Europe.

Expected Outcome:
  • to increase media coverage on Cohesion policy, in particular at regional level
  • to enhance people's awareness of the results of Cohesion policy and their impact on their lives
  • to achieve concrete outputs and deliverables aimed at wide outreach within the measure's duration – e.g. TV and radio broadcast, online or print coverage, other type of information measures and dissemination - taking multilingualism into account.
Objective:

The main aim of the call is to provide support for the production and dissemination of information and content linked to EU Cohesion policy, including inter alia the Just Transition Fund, or relevant support under the Recovery Plan for Europe or from the Technical Support Instrument.

The proposals should provide coherent, objective and comprehensive information, in order to give an accurate overall picture of the EU Cohesion policy. The proposals should illustrate and assess the role of Cohesion policy in delivering the EU’s political priorities and in addressing current and future challenges for the EU, its Member States, its regions and the local level.

Scope:

The geographical scope of this call is focussed on EU Member States, including overseas countries and territories (OCTs).

The information measures should include one or several activities such as:

  • production and distribution of print, multimedia or audiovisual material
  • web and social media outreach activities
  • media events
  • conferences, seminars, workshops.

projects.TITLE: The Great Beauty Of Europe
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
Since EU Cohesion policy is not well known among citizens, the project “The Great Beauty of Europe” aims to promote it through gamification and face-to-face activities in order to raise awareness with a special focus on cultural heritage. The Project will mix several types of activities in order to achieve the maximum multiplying effect. Social media activities, online media activities will be integrated, through a detailed scheduling, with face-to-face events in inspirational locations, in presence activities engaging the target groups through gamification and competitions, as well as press events and a final event. The following specific objectives of the were identified:
SO0 – QUALITY AND MANAGEMENT
SO1 - TO INCREASE AWARENESS AND KNOWLEDGE OF PROJECTS FUNDED THROUGH COHESION POLICY
SO2 - TO INCREASE CIVIC PARTICIPATION AND SENSE OF EUROPEAN CITIZENSHIP
SO3 - TO INFORM AND PROMOTE A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE ROLE OF COHESION POLICY
SO4 - TO DISSEMINATE INFORMATION AND CONTENT ON COHESION POLICY
SO5 - TO DISSEMINATE AMONG THE CITIZENS THE SPECIFIC KNOWLEDGE OF THE PROJECTS FINANCED BY COHESION POLICIES
Specifically, the project aims at reaching the specific objectives through the realization of:
The QRace-sion web app, a digital tool capable of promoting the points of interest (POI) representing the investments of the cohesion policy on the territory and the digital activities will constitute an element of involvement that will guide the visitors in experience, will promote understanding of the role of cohesion policy in providing support to all regions of the EU.
Phygital Cafés Cohesion, events to increase the sense of European citizenship among general public and stakeholders.
Additionally, a series of unconventional communication actions such as digital invasions and an influencer marketing plan.
This set of activities and strategies positions The Great Beauty of Europe as a model for enhancing cohesion policies in EU.

projects.TITLE: Cohesion Policy - New Challenges for Europe
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
The main objective of this project is the promotion of the Cohesion Policy (CP) in Poland, through media activities (articles  and films) and webinars addressed to recipients from target groups – viewers of 48 local television stations and readers of 750 local news websites in Poland focusing on delivering information about EU Funds and initiatives such as:
- European Regional Development Fund (ERDF)
- European Social Fund Plus (ESF+)
- the Cohesion Fund (CF)
- Just Transition Fund (JTF)
- REACT-EU
- European Territorial Cooperation (ETC or Interreg).

We will focus on the five objectives of regional policy: the building of a smarter, greener, more connected and more social Europe that is closer to its citizens. Each of the areas will be discussed in the context of the CP assumptions and provisions.

The duration of the project will be 12 months.

• Months 1-2 
The preparation of the substantive part (as described in further in the packages), which will be carried out for 10 consecutive months (3-10). During this period all the preliminary actions will be conducted; experts conducting webinars and translators will be recruited; a landing page will be designed; first TV materials will be shot.

• Months 3-12
The substantive part will cover in each of the areas:
- A series of articles published in 100 local media throughout Poland (internet portals, local TV stations) in total of 2 p/month (20 in total)
- A series of tv broadcasts dedicated to the key issues within each of the predefined areas will be broadcast at local TV stations and over 100 internet news portals, approximately 15 mins. each, 2 p/month (20 in total).
- A series of 60-minutes long free webinars addressed to the project stakeholders, led by the experts. 1 webinar per month (10 in total)
- Free e-book containing all of the materials published within the project and active links to all downloadable from 750 local media websites 

As the result we should reach 8 million people

projects.TITLE: Transition opportunities for jobs creation and career development
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
The successful transition towards a climate-neutral economy must ensure reduction of inequalities, creation of net employment effect with new high-quality jobs, while strengthening competitiveness. Therefore, the support that the EU Cohesion policy and Just transition fund provide for the territories most negatively impacted by the transition, in particular coal-mining regions, is crucial for diversifying and revitalizing their local economies and in creating sustainable employment opportunities for impacted workers. 
Transition opportunities for jobs creation and career development (TOP JOBS) will produce and disseminate information and content linked to EU Cohesion policy results and opportunities for creating new jobs and ensuring sustainable development of the labor market in the regions. The project will emphasize the numerous opportunities for employment, jobs creation, entrepreneurship, and up-skilling, which CP and JTF are bringing and will continue to create in the country and the three Bulgarian coal regions. In doing so, the project will address the main concerns of the residents related to rising unemployment rate, increasing poverty and declining professional opportunities for younger generations, which may cause rising depopulation in these regions even before the coal phase-out. Under the project, 7 public regional events and large-scale communication campaign will target local stakeholders and citizens. The events will raise awareness on the invaluable contribution of EU`s financial instruments in ensuring the greening of the European economy in a fair and inclusive way to everyone concerned, creating decent work opportunities, and leaving no one behind.  BMB will involve more than 2600 residents of the 3 BG regions in a dialogue for their future using innovative communication instruments. The result will be increased acceptance of the Green Deal & skills and capacity of local stakeholders to contribute to sustainable development of the regions.

projects.TITLE: Rivincite is a documentary web series by Somewhere Studio in Media Partnership with Corriere della Sera
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective: """Rivincite"" (Return matches) is a multi-level communication project developed by Somewhere Studio in Media Partnership with “Il Corriere della Sera”, the first news source in Italy, with 28.6 million of monthly unique users and a social media audience of 5 million users. The project includes a web series of video documentaries aimed at the national public; long-form articles; a social media campaign crossing both national and local audiences; a series of capacity-building live webinars for local administrators. Corriere.it's unmatched platform for communicating to the national Italian public will deliver Somewhere Studio's character-driven documentaries and social media stories. Somewhere Studio will bring to a next level, in this way, the experience developed with ""Crescere in Europa"", its recent Infome project that was able to reach 1,3 million people with personal stories of EU co-founded activities. The Rivincite web series on Corriere.it will present real, living examples of how EU Cohesion policy can impact lives and territories, allowing a wide reach (thanks to video, the main type of content search by online audiences), an identification process and an approach that entertains and informs. The documentaries will focus on stories of social inclusion and regional development supported by Eu Cohesion policy. “Rivincite” and “il Corriere della Sera” will publish the documentaries and their related in-depth informative articles in a row of 10 consecutive Sundays, while social media engagement will be kept across project's duration. Alongside the publication of the web series and the social media contents, Somewhere Studio will host on Crescere in Europa's profile 10 live webinars with European funds' experts, aimed to a selected groups of local administrators and community stakeholders of the territories involved in the stories, to translate the stories into case studies for capacity building and knowledge sharing on Eu Cohesion funds' opportunities."
Keywords: web series; documentary; social media; video; Corriere della Sera; inclusion; character-driven; personal stories; real stories; webinars; capacity building;

projects.TITLE: Unveiling the Significance of Cohesion Policy for EU Citizens
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective: The Cohesion4(E)U aims to effectively support and enhance the dissemination of information related to the EU Cohesion policy by employing a multifaceted approach to deliver accurate, comprehensive, and engaging content that illustrates the significance of Cohesion policy in achieving the EU's priorities and addressing current and future challenges for the EU, its Member States, its regions and the local level. Therefore, our project's mission is to serve as a dynamic and inclusive platform for facilitating a deeper connection between Cohesion policy and the communities it serves, thereby fostering a sense of ownership, collaboration, and participation. We will inspire and engage a wide spectrum of audiences, from the general public to stakeholders, including NGOs, businesses, beneficiaries, and academic and public authorities.  To create a better understanding of and engagement with EU Cohesion policy, the project will encompass a series of activities such as online media activations including infographics, social media campaigns, podcasts, e-banners, online polls, online articles, and a vlogging series; traditional media activities such as TV and radio spots, reportages, radio interviews, and printed press; dissemination events including a networking session, tour events, and themed events for young people aligned with the five goals of Cohesion policy, as well as interactive installations in public spaces to create immersive educational experiences for citizens, launched through a festival. Therefore, the project anticipates showcasing the tangible impact of Cohesion policy on local communities, cultivating a positive opinion among EU citizens as well as garnering increased support, leading to stronger advocacy and collaboration in Cohesion policy implementation. By fostering engagement and information-sharing, the project seeks to contribute to the broader discussion on the future of Cohesion policy and thereby of Europe.

projects.TITLE: Advancing European aWAreness on cohesion policy through Responsible media Engagement
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
Though popular awareness of the EU Regional Policy has improved recently, there is still room for improvement in the EU's general understanding and appreciation of the Cohesion Policy. This context is characterized by: low perception of the impact of the EU policies, skepticism towards the EU, communication bottlenecks. Since 2021 the awareness of the ERDF and CF has decreased at EU level (49% in 2021 vs 46% in 2023). AWARE will produce and distribute content and information, raise knowledge of and lessen skepticism about the EU Cohesion Policy, and improve media professionals' ability to communicate throughout Europe in order to maximize the effectiveness of communicating CP-related contents. More specifically, AWARE aims at:
1.Promote cooperation between media professionals and specialists (such as companies, associations, advertising agencies, and newspapers) to develop standards for communicating the Cohesion Policy in Europe in an efficient manner that takes into consideration national variations.
2.Through a variety of online content platforms, enhance citizens' contact and participation at the national and regional levels regarding the benefits of the EU's Cohesion Policy. One such platform is an information box that is presented on Fanpage.it’s homepage, two video-educational, three video-reportage, and three podcasts with video components.  The videos will be available with subtitles in English, French, and Spanish in addition to Italian.
3.Showcase 7 initiatives that won REGIOSTARS awards between 2021 and 2027 to highlight the significance and integration of regional development. To achieve this 4 info-galleries will be created by Geopop and 3 branded and 3 Instagram pieces will be shared via Fanpage channels.
The selection of the formats has been tailored to the characteristics of the online users (educational level, typology of news preferred and age) as well as media stakeholders.
Keywords: media coverage on Cohesion policy ; Regio Stars projects awareness

projects.TITLE: Veřejná debata o evropských fondech / Public debate on EU funds
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
"European funds? In the Czech Republic they are, and are not. Except for signs on construction sites saying ""With financial contribution from the EU"", specialised websites like DotaceEU.cz and the technical work of the state administration, it is as if EU funds do not exist. However, they do exist, but somewhere ""in between"" - thanks to the awareness of subsidies the Eurosceptic Czech Republic moved two years ago into the ranks of Member States that perceive EU membership positively as a whole. However, there are still sections of society including media that perceive EU funds as a threat to the economy or a bogeyman for municipalities and companies with too much administration.
	Czech News Agency (CTK), based on everyday practice and its media and non-media partnership capabilities, wants to change this situation. In the spirit of Call IMREG-2023-INFOME, CTK is calling on its own and external professionals and chosen partners to ""Let's talk about the funds"". Not theorise, really discuss. In live talks in selected cities, with local governments, companies and entrepreneurs, with the media and citizens. Let's talk about what the funds were, are and can be for. Let's show the undecided how the EU offer has been taken up by others and elsewhere, popularise the funds by competing for the best projects in cooperation with the Union of Towns and Municipalities and the Representative Office of the European Commission in Prague. Let's draw the listeners into the topic through podcasts by the recognized expert Petr Zahradník, and bring together all the created media outputs on one publicly accessible portal. Let’s provide people with an app that delivers ""funds"" to their smartphones, publicize it all on the radio.
	It probably won't all be perfect, if only because we are taking a new approach to the issue of cohesion policy. If there is no debate about this, we can start one. It is worth a try.
"

projects.TITLE: Europe is You
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
The general objective of this project is to provide information by producing and disseminating relevant materials and content online linked to EU Cohesion policy, including inter alia the Just Transition Fund, the Recovery Plan for Europe and the Technical Support Instrument. The project will also focus on the Next Generation EU programme, and within that the RRF.

The project will segment target audiences in both Hungary and in neighbouring countries where a significant Hungarian speaking community is present in current Member States, such as Slovakia and Romania, as well as for current candidate countries, Serbia and Ukraine. This will allow project partners to convey messages effectively to target audiences and maximise impact.

The cooperation between Portfolio.hu and Euractiv will provide citizens with up-to-date information about the impact of Cohesion policy and aims at increasing the number of Hungarians (and Hungarian speaking communities) who have a solid knowledge about Cohesion Policy and its impacts, as well as improving media coverage on the impacts and future of Cohesion Policy in Hungary and Hungarian speaking communities, as well as in Brussels. These efforts will also be complementary to Euractiv’s activities to inform stakeholders in Brussels about the achievements of Cohesion policy in Hungary and its contribution to the green transition.

An analysis will be done on the contribution of EU funding instruments (including Cohesion policy and ERDF) to implementing the European Capitals of Culture programme, as well as the results of the ‘Conference on the Future of Europe’ and the European Citizens Panel. Questionnaires will allow the project to tailor its communication strategies, educate the audience, gather stakeholder insights, measure impact, and contribute valuable data to policy discussions. Based on inputs from stakeholders, policy recommendations will be formulated on the future of Cohesion policy and the next MFF.

projects.TITLE: MEET EUROPE - (Make, Engage, Empower, Transform) Europe
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
The MEET EUROPE project stems from the need to raise awareness of the achievements of the European Cohesion Policies in the Ecological Transition process and the impact generated on citizens' lives. Our proposal includes:
• an annual educational project aimed at pupils in Classes III, IV and V of Secondary Schools, involving more than 2,500 students (i.e. around 50 high schools nationwide). The project is part of a three-year educational plan called GEA EDU (by the Green Economy Agency), which will begin its third year in the 2024/25 school year (December 24 - May 25);
• a dedicated dissemination initiative, divided into three phases:
o the presence in at least 100 'special pages' (editorial and advertising), created with the help of the young people, which will be conveyed to at least 20 daily newspapers on national, regional and provincial pre-purchased space, with an estimated readership of 6.5 million for each publication;
o a strong digital promotion initiative
o attendance at 6 national visibility events organized on specific topics
The educational paths on EU cohesion policies are presented to young people (who will vote in 2024) with workshops by their teachers, who are provided with a multimedia teaching kit, usable in digital and traditional modes. Each month the classes will submit outputs in which they will explain what they have learnt to the adults. Withub’s journalists will integrate these works into ‘special pages’ and advertising to be published for a fee in newspapers and to be distributed on our editorial properties (e.g. Eunews and Green Economy Agency). Selected classes will be invited to participate in events attended by Italian and European institutions.
The project aims to create thousands of ambassadors who will spread the meaning of the cohesion policies in the ecological transition and their effects on the individual territories to other peers, teachers, family members and 'citizens'.
Keywords: Education Dissemination Cohesion School Students Daily Newspapers Events

projects.TITLE: Speaking Cohesion? Locally
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
The Project Speaking Cohesion? Locally is a multi-layered information and communication campaign designed to increase public knowledge and public awareness on the contribution of the EU Cohesion policy (including Just Transition Fund and Recovery and Resilience Facility) to the local communities in Slovenia. The project is divided into phase 1 that is dedicated to the research and preparation of information and promotional materials - animated videos and comics and phase 2 that is oriented to the dissemination of this information to the local communities throughout Slovenia. On the second stage we will 
- organise 10 live events in at least 9 different locations where we will combine comics exhibitions with promotion of the Cohesion policy and its results in the local area. 2 events will be focused more on the stakeholders and will be implemented in Ljubljana (kick off and closing conference)
- prepare 3 animated videos with the explanation of the Cohesion policy (similar as the ones done in the previous programme) 
- prepare and broadcast 23 radio shows
- conduct interviews with 50 stakeholders presented in podcasts
- prepare and publish 10 video reportages
- organise poster contest to get the most innovative and advanced poster solutions to be shown at 150 poster posts around the country
- hold an interactive stand at the annual non-governmental fair to attract bystanders
- provide fresh and new information on www.govoris-kohezijsko.si multimedia portal
- maintain an active social media presence (FB, IG, X). 
The actions are aimed at a wide target audience with a special focus on local communities, municipalities, NGOs as we’ll bring the information to the public places in their vicinity with the aim to raise awareness and visibility of the Cohesion policy contribution to their everyday life.

Participants.Organization Name: ZAVOD CENTER ZA INFORMIRANJE SODELOVANJE IN RAZVOJ NEVLADNIH ORGANIZACIJ

projects.TITLE: Enhancing Hungary's tomorrow: Empowering communities through trustworthy journalism on EU cohesion policies
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
EmpowerHun aims to inform Hungarian citizens about the EU's cohesion policy, focusing on economic development, ecological and digital transitions, and journalism ethics. The project enhances quality journalism at regional and local levels, strengthening media plurality and credibility. It supports independent media by creating a diverse, secure platform for media professionals, promoting editorial collaboration and audience engagement. EmpowerHun also tackles disinformation and propaganda, boosting access to trustworthy journalism to raise public awareness about the cohesion policy's impact.
The project comprises four core activities. WP 2 facilitates the ongoing exchange of information on cohesion policy debates among Hungarian journalists and media outlets. WP 3 enhances journalist capacity through Brussels study visits, providing deep insights into EU dynamics and policies, accompanied by training, mentoring, and tutoring throughout the project. The last two work packages focus on collaboratively producing media content, including 'Cohesion Stories' and investigative journalism highlighting the peripheral regions of Hungary. These activities aim to increase public awareness of the cohesion policy's effects on citizens' lives. EmpowerHun primarily targets independent journalists and media outlets across Hungary, reaching out to citizens unfamiliar with EU activities. It seeks to foster long-term, sustainable understanding of EU policies among journalists and Hungarian citizens.

Participants.Organization Name: BUDAPEST SZAKPOLITIKAI ELEMZO INTEZET KORLATOLT FELELOSSEGU TARSASAG

projects.TITLE: Europe Close Up:  A Pan-European TV and Online Series on EU Cohesion Policy's Regional Impact
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
"""Europe Close Up"" is a collaborative media project developed by STUDIO 47, alongside regional broadcasters in Germany, Austria, and the Netherlands. This innovative TV and online media series is dedicated to elucidating the EU Cohesion Policy, employing a dynamic blend of compelling storytelling, insightful interviews, and vivid cinematography.
The primary goal of ""Europe Close Up"" is to deepen public comprehension and engagement with the EU Cohesion Policy. The strategy involves creating five 15-minute episodes that shed light on the policy's influence across diverse European regions. The series aims to demystify the policy's complexities, making it more approachable and relevant for a wide audience. It highlights personal stories to personify the policy’s impact, fostering a sense of shared European identity and promoting active democratic engagement.
""Europe Close Up"" will be broadcast in prime-time slots across the five regional TV stations to maximize reach and impact. Complementing this, the project embraces digital media's growing role by disseminating content online, thus expanding its audience. The multi-platform approach includes producing multilingual content and incorporating interactive online features to enhance inclusivity and outreach. The project's success will be gauged through viewer ratings, online engagement, and audience feedback, aiming to significantly surpass current engagement levels. Aligning with the Work Programme's goals, ""Europe Close Up"" promotes a deeper understanding of EU policies' regional effects. It contributes to regional media coverage of EU affairs and empowers citizens with knowledge for active European democratic participation.
""Europe Close Up"" represents a commitment to top-tier, collaborative journalism, fostering an informed and active European community. Its implementation is set to make a substantial contribution to the nability of the European Union by nurturing an informed dialogue between citizens and policymakers."

Participants.Organization Name: STUDIO 47 STADTFERNSEHEN DUISBURG GMBH & CO KG

projects.TITLE: Investing in Sustainable and Vibrant Regions
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
Building on previous experience with the communication activities in the Regional Policy, the proposed project will employ multi-channel, multimedia communication measures to produce and disseminate information on the EU Cohesion policy, its funding mechanism, and its implementation at the national level. The proposal combines production and distribution of online content, cooperation with media (including print newspapers), social media content, events, and supporting communication and dissemination measures.
A strong consortium of 5 partners will implement the project: EURACTIV.sk, an online news and policy portal that covers the EU Cohesion policy for more than 20 years, Association of Towns and Communities of Slovakia (ZMOS), the largest association of the the municipalities with 2784 members, Association of Self-governing Regions (SK8) that brings together all eight Slovak self-governing regions, publishing house of the major Slovak daily Dennik N (N Press), and the Technical University of Kosice (TUKE) with its Department of the Regional Policy. This combination of media (EURACTIV.sk, NPress), stakeholder associations (ZMOS, SK8), and academic institutions (TUKE) are well-suited to reach wide and diverse target groups and create synergies for efficient and effective communication of the EU Cohesion policy. 
Numerous crises the EU faces could derail the successful implementation of the EU Cohesion policy. This underlines the importance of coherent, objective, and comprehensive information on the policy, regional development in general, and its environmental, social, and economic aspects. The mix of proposed communication activities (online multimedia content, cooperation with media, events, and engagement activities) will build trust, increase the engagement of the target groups, and support the quality of the quality and relevance of the public policy debates, including by addressing misconceptions and disinformation.

projects.TITLE: Cohesion with us
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
"Despite the obvious benefits Cohesion brings for Cyprus, citizens seem to be unaware of the impact the policy has on their everyday lives. According to the findings of the 2023 Eurobarometer 531 only 35% of the Cypriots knew at least one project in their area that was funded by EU funds. Our objective is to help citizens associate themselves with Cohesion Policy and help them to be actively involved in the debate about the future of the Policy.

Our project builds on the positive experience gained by the project ""Cohesion is us"": We maintain our partnership, composed of 3 national media (TV, Radio and online news), a company specialised on EU information campaigns and a Foundation with strong links to the local authorities and the society and we are now adding more content and more interaction with our audiences, aiming not just to inform, but to mobilise citizens and stakeholders for actively discussing the future of the Cohesion policy.

We designed a project with two main components: information to help citizens understand Cohesion and its impact on their everyday lives (media news, websites, podcasts, publications) and engagement to help citizens and stakeholders express their views and ideas for the future of the Cohesion policy (seminars, interactive events, contests, public consultations).

During the 12 months of implementation, we will provide sustained coverage to Cohesion with dedicated slots at mainstream TV and radio shows and in one of the most prominent news webpages. We will offer news reportages and articles (TV, radio, online), podcasts, multimedia stories, 1 modular movie on Cohesion, seminars for professors and teachers, online consultations, blog posts, contests, extensive social media exposure and an event that will connect Europe day with Cohesion."

projects.TITLE: COhesion INnovation Stories: con l’Europa innoviamo l’Italia. Un viaggio nella transizione digitale e green.
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
Il progetto prevede la realizzazione di una strategia di comunicazione e azioni informative tese verso la valorizzazione del positivo ruolo dell’UE nel sostenere la modernizzazione del Paese e nel supporto alla crescita dei territori a partire da quelli svantaggiati. 
Per avere più cittadini informati e pronti a cogliere le sfide e le opportunità dalla politica di coesione, si punta a creare una maggiore consapevolezza del benessere socioeconomico apportato attraverso l’utilizzo dei fondi strutturali per l’innovazione in Italia a partire dal racconto delle operazioni finanziate e nella divulgazione dei loro impatti (anche in una logica di sistema). 
Attraverso un mix di prodotti di comunicazione che coinvolgeranno anche i soggetti moltiplicatori e portatori di interesse collettivo si raggiungerà il grande pubblico con la promozione delle azioni innovative sostenute dalla UE con contenuti multilivello, basati sulla contestualizzazione e narrazione di storie di successo.

Il bilancio sociale delle operazioni, in una chiave comunicativa ampia e di facile accessibilità al pubblico generalista, sarà costituito da:

- 7 Dossier Tematici su scala nazionale:
 
o	RIS3
o	Sviluppo urbano e Smart City
o	Agenda digitale 
o	Imprese Innovative 
o	Ambiente
o	Transizione Energetica
o	Reti e Trasporti Sostenibili

- 6 Dossier Regionali:

o	Campania
o	Sicilia
o	Calabria
o	Puglia
o	Lazio
o	Emilia-Romagna 

Saranno realizzati inoltre i seguenti prodotti di comunicazione:
 
-	2 videoreportage 
-	6 podcast 
-	1 video podcast 
-	13 eMagazine 
-	48 contenuti editoriali (post, infografiche, animazioni, social card, articoli, sondaggi) 

L’ampia disseminazione sarà garantita da uscite settimanali sulle testate del network D360 e MeridianaLab veicolate in collaborazione con i soggetti attuatori e i beneficiari.

L’organizzazione di due eventi, uno territoriale ed uno nazionale, rafforzerà il progetto, le reti e le comunità di interesse, ampliandone il raggio d'azione.

projects.TITLE: Pulse of Europe - Weekly Supplement in Lithuanian Newspapers and a parallel online publication on the websites of various regional newspapers, administration of a dedicated website, EUROPOSPULSAS.LT.
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective: """Pulse of Europe"" - Weekly Supplement in Lithuanian Newspapers and a parallel online publication on the websites of various regional newspapers. The initiative also encompasses the administration of a dedicated website, EUROPOSPULSAS.LT, which serves as a central hub for all digital content.Each week, ""Pulse of Europe"" will present a range of articles, success stories, interviews, and analyses that showcase the tangible outcomes of the EU Cohesion Policy in local communities across Lithuania. The content is meticulously curated to cater to a wide audience, ranging from the general public to policymakers and stakeholders, ensuring that it is both accessible and informative.  In addition to the print supplements, the initiative's digital presence on regional newspaper websites and the dedicated portal EUROPOSPULSAS.LT will significantly amplify its reach and accessibility. This dual approach – print and digital – ensures comprehensive coverage and allows for interactive engagement with the readers through multimedia elements, comment sections, and social media integration.  The website EUROPOSPULSAS.LT will not only archive all published materials but also offer additional resources such as infographics, video interviews, and interactive maps highlighting project locations and impacts.  This project is pivotal in promoting transparency, accountability, and the positive impacts of EU funding. By making the Cohesion Policy's outcomes visible and tangible, ""Pulse of Europe"" contributes to building a sense of European identity and solidarity, while fostering a well-informed public discourse on European matters in Lithuania.  Overall, ""Pulse of Europe"" represents a comprehensive effort to bring the EU closer to its citizens, demystifying policies, celebrating successes, and fostering an informed and engaged community."

projects.TITLE: Kohezija za vse: Brez Meja /Senza confini
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
The project proposal is based on building awareness about the role EU Cohesion policy has on lives of Europeans, focusing on Interreg cross-border cooperation. Collaboration between PiNA , national broadcaster RTV Slovenia and RAI FJK, will create and spread information about Interreg, and especially the cross-border program Italy-Slovenia, and thus provide much-needed context to main target groups and individuals.
The project proposal is based on two successful implementations (GREEN Cohesion and GREEN Cohesion for YOUTH) and the understanding the needs of the defined target groups. It joins communication and educational efforts, in order to inform and raise the participation of target groups in the development of Interreg programs post 2027. Communication efforts will result in 15 television reportages for established TV shows, 2 talk show, 10 thematic radio shows, more than 30 multimedia on-line contribution, 3 participations the morning television show “Dobro jutro”. All produced media materials will be broadcasted on the channels of RTV Slovenia and RAI FJK. To promote good practices and results of past project 5 thematic itineraries for high school excursions and family trips will be developed. The promotion of itineraries will be done through the media campaign “Čezmejne sledi”, which will consist of 5 TV reportages, 5 field radio shows and 5 advertisements. All the campaign materials will be broadcasted on RTV Slovenia and RAI FJK. 
Educational efforts will be focused on developing of educational contents including educational materials and tools for high school student and information materials for stakeholders, including citizens of the region. 
During its duration, the proposed project will connect partner organizations, strengthen the understanding of cohesion policy and Interreg among the target groups and foster active participation involved young people and stakeholders. Special emphasizes will be giver to dissemination, as the produced tools/
