projects.Objective:
"The Will EU 2 project has been crafted taking into consideration the diverse landscape outlined above. It operates on the belief that Be Content SRL and its affiliated entity, IS MEDIA, can make a significant impact and contribute to enhancing public awareness of the strategic role played by the Cohesion Policy for all European citizens, with a particular focus on Italy.
The consortium applying for this tender has strategically aligned the expertise and professionalism of its entities to ensure precise proficiency in the implementation phase and the targeted achievement of the grant’s objectives. The team encompasses technical and journalistic personnel, as well as management control, promotion, and marketing staff. Their presence has facilitated and will continue to enable the meticulous gathering of detailed information about the project's reference context, defining it with the utmost precision and understanding the rationale behind the organizational work model.
Podcasts and social networks, being easily ""measurable"" communication channels, play a pivotal role. Real-time monitoring of public satisfaction allows for a targeted information strategy tailored to the reference target, primarily consisting of the younger generation. Podcasts and social networks are the preferred information tools for this public, making them effective mediums for communication
"

projects.TITLE: EU4regions - visiting the Euro regions and their climate projects: Multimedia coverage of the EU Cohesion policy in Germany
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
"Cohesion policy has defined clear objectives for the 2021-2027 funding period: A smart Europe through innovation, a greener, low-carbon Europe, a more connected Europe, a more social Europe and a Europe that is closer to its citizens. Sustainable challenges are becoming the focus of society, particularly in Germany and its neighbouring countries.
The ""EU4regions"" project will produce high-quality multimedia and journalistic information on cohesion policy and then disseminate it widely. Within 12 months, we will report on Interreg projects from western and eastern Germany and neighbouring countries/regions to highlight local challenges. The countries concerned are Poland, the Czech Republic, Austria, Switzerland, France, the Netherlands and Denmark. 
Our thematic focus is on sustainability, whereby we understand sustainability as a whole. Although climate issues are at the centre of attention, they are complemented by economic and social aspects. The aim is to use personal stories and insights to show how EU cohesion policy affects regions and people.
The project involves the production and distribution of 13 content packages in German and one other language. 12 content packages relate to specific Interreg projects from Germany and one each from a neighbouring country. One content package is dedicated to cohesion policy in general and provides basic information on questions such as: What is cohesion policy and how does it work? This content package serves as an introduction and is produced in German, in easy-to-understand language (German, level A2) and in English and distributed in 8 countries. 
Our content strategy includes a multimedia approach. Text, video and image formats will complement each other and offer the opportunity to serve different target groups. A particular focus is on the creation of social media content to appeal to a younger target group.
"

projects.TITLE: reUnitEd: Pomocna dłoń w potrzebie – małe wielkie historie o Europejskiej Polityce Spójności
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
"The main goal of the project is to raise awareness of people with a low understanding of the essence and the impact of the European Cohesion Policy on the quality of everyday life of residents of small and medium-sized Polish cities and areas struggling with the difficult decarbonization process.

The goal will be achieved through implementation of a campaign involving national and regional press, Internet, video format and social media - showing the effects of European Cohesion Policy through the prism of the stories of given individuals from small and medium-sized towns and areas undergoing decarbonization process. 

We will achieve the goal when we ensure a wide reach of the campaign, i.e.:
- 27 million 600 thousand contacts with the campaign content in press among the readers in cities up to 200,000 inhabitants, 14 million in the group aged 55+ and 4 million 400 thousand among people aged to 34 years,
- 900 thousand views of a dedicated section on the se.pl home page,
- 4.8 million contacts with the poll's video content.

The objectives of the project and its activities are relevant to this ""Call” by focusing on: 
1. Building awareness of EU Cohesion Policy among the least aware groups, 
2. Showing the impact of the EU Cohesion Policy in the immediate environment, applying the effects of using EU funds in everyday activities, 
3. Building the whole campaign taking into account “More Social Europe, supporting social inclusion” goal and focusing on problematic areas dealing with decarbonisation (areas covered by The Just Transition Fund).

Project’s Work Packages:
1. Social innovations - a helping hand in need,
2. Small and medium-sized Polish cities - stories you need to know,
3. The human face of transformation,
4. Project management and evaluation."

projects.TITLE: Cohesion policy funds - for growth of Latvia
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective: The project ‘Cohesion policy funds - for growth of Latvia’ is designed to raise the awareness of Cohesion policy priorities, instruments, implementation, and results among Latvians by improThe project ‘Cohesion policy funds - for growth of Latvia’ is designed to raise the awareness Cohesion policy priorities, instruments, implementation and results among Latvian by improving media coverage on Cohesion policy programmes and initiatives in Latvia. The project seeks to gather the variety of actors to create quality media material of analytical nature, by engaging industry experts, academia, civil society, public authorities and other stakeholders in assessing specific areas covered by the EU Cohesion Policy. The team of media professionals will process gathered information and support communication actions of the public authorities in delivering comprehensive and updated information on the Cohesion policy priorities and projects in areas such as (1) innovative and smart economic transition, (2) ICT and e-governance, (3) competitiveness of SMEs, (4) transition to a low-carbon economy, (5) environmental protection, (6) sustainable transportation and mobility, (7) employment and labour, (8) education and lifelong learning, and (9) social inclusion. A number of traditional and online media channels, such as printed press, radio, online media platforms and social media, will be employed to reach a wide scope of audiences or various age, professional interests and media consumption habits. A series of the media articles and a media campaign will be designed to inform and provide detailed explanations on the Cohesion policy in action. By translating Cohesion policy actions, the awareness of and interest about the Cohesion policy and administration will increase among the industry experts and general public, therefore raising the accountability of the public sector in Latvia in what comes to efficient and sustainable management of the Cohesion policy funds and other resources.

projects.TITLE: Greener, smarter, closer: our future
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
How can we share what we are doing to foster a smarter, greener, better connected, more social and more balanced Europe? How can the largest media group in Portugal, that connects daily with more than 20% of the Portuguese population, in that direction?  

Over the course of 12 months, our goal is to create the largest media platform in Portugal relating to the 2021-2027 regional and cohesion policy agenda, with over 100 pieces of content distributed between TV, print, and digital and social media channels of Impresa.We intend to reach, every week, for 52 weeks, 2,5 million viewers, readers, and subscribers, mobilizing Portuguese public opinion in a very particular European member state. With European and general elections, 2024 will be a testing ground for mainstream parties in Portugal, given the rise of extremist/anti-immigration parties. This EU funding package will also be the last chance for Portugal to catch up with the Union average, since future enlargement and financial limitations, will reduce our share of EU funds. 

We've structured this project, first and foremost, to reply to these challenges, with each work package looking at specific objectives:
After WP1, dedicated to project management, WP2 – titled “Smarter, more competitive” - will showcase work done with the EU Cohesion Fund, namely the road to contribute to a more competitive, smarter Europe in Portugal. 

Them, WP3 – “Greener, mores sustainable” - will highlight the path to zero carbon economy, energy transition and a more sustainable environment, cross-referencing with the ERDF, Cohesion and Just Transition Funds.

Lastly, WP4 – “Closer, more social” - will bring to the public 20 projects in Portugal that best illustrate the 20 principles of the European Social Rights, created content for digital and social media platforms of Expresso, hoping to connect our readers – over 230 000 – to the priorities set by the European Social Fund+ and Just Transition Fund, working for a closer EU.

projects.TITLE: Talent4Regions
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
"The RTV Slovenija project entitled ""Talents4Regions"" focuses on the European demographic problem, 'Talent Trap' – EU regions in the trap of underdevelopment and lacking talent. Do the regions know how to address the correct demographic issues? Is the creativity of talents rewarded? We have answers to the question: How can we stop emigration?
These questions focus on network media projects with various shows and channels to improve awareness about European cohesion policy and this specific topic amongst the general public, young people and decision-makers. The national television broadcaster will produce a series of 26 short shows presenting good practices from 11 European countries, which will be broadcasted on the Slovenian national television TV SLO, the Croatian national television HRT, the Bosnian television BRT TV.
The national radio will produce 40 shows, including two original radio plays, public concerts and podcasts. It will broadcast them on three central and regional radio channels of RTV Slovenija, posted in Italy and Austria. Concerts will be available for EBU exchange.
Promotional events will be organised as part of the EUSAIR and Interreg projects, a digital hub in Novi Sad (Serbia) and a radio show and concert in Murska Sobota (Slovenia). 
The RTV Multimedia Centre is committed to creating a media support network that is recognisable and accessible to all. Media support also includes promotion and dissemination on social media, with specially targeted video documentaries featuring innovative young individuals living in rural areas in Slovenia.  All content will be available on our online platform, with TV series also featured on the Agroklub platform in Croatia. Dostopno.si will provide access to the content for the deaf and hard of hearing and those who are blind and visually impaired. Enostavno.si will provide content adapted for easy-to-read and easy-to-understand.
"
Keywords: underdeveloped regions,talent trap,lack of talents,young generation

projects.TITLE: ISPACohesion: Informing the Spanish Public about the EU Cohesion Policy
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
ISPA Cohesion transcends a mere collaboration; it is a narrative unfolding in the digital space, fostering enlightenment and informed citizenship. In the dynamic realm of Spanish digital media, ISPA Cohesion emerges as a a 3-part national campaign that will be conducted by Spanish media organizations - Maldita.es, elDiario.es, and El Orden Mundial. With a collective monthly reach of 23 million and over 5 million social media followers, this alliance seeks to redefine public understanding of the EU Cohesion policy.

ISPA Cohesion orchestrates a symphony of impact, resonating across traditional websites and diverse social media channels.  The narrative, enriched with facts, resonates not only on media websites but across a myriad of social media platforms. A weekly cadence of newsletters and bulletins sustains engagement, while live-streamed events bring the public into the dialogue, where key stakeholders and the public engage in conversations that transcend the digital realm.  

With an strategic approach: 
- Maldita.es, renowned for its fact-checking prowess, takes the lead in the first chapter. Picture a realm where meticulously crafted articles, unraveling in attractive and simple formats the intricacies of EU Cohesion policy, flood the digital space. From climate initiatives to social funds, these articles are designed to be the beacon of clarity, ensuring the Spanish public is armed against the tide of misinformation.
-  ElDiario takes the reins, steering the narrative towards the local landscapes shaped by EU Cohesion funds. Imagine the unfolding stories—a coal plant closure in A Coruña, a revolutionary educational program, and the metamorphosis of regions through renewable energy.
- In the final chapter, El Orden Mundial, with a flair for geopolitical storytelling, unveils the broader canvas. An in-depth investigation peels back the layers of Europe's most unequal borders, exploring the impact of Cohesion funds on societal structures.

projects.TITLE: 2023-BG-INFOME-ЕК EU on Balkans: Cohesion Skill
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
Although Cohesion Policy is Europe’s main investment tool, people and local authorities are not sufficiently informed about these opportunities provided by the European Union. If aware of this, in any region, a citizen would have the opportunity to use his knowledge power and advise the local authority where funding is needed to improve the situation in the region.  Continued reflections on how Cohesion Policy can generate the best produce desired results in all regions concerned by such skilled labour emigration are needed.
Effective communication on Cohesion policy in different countries and contexts, especially in Balkan region with its past and current challenges, is the key factor of raising people’s awareness about the role of the European Cohesion Policy. 
The main aim of the Project is to provide coherent, objective and comprehensive information, in order to give an accurate overall picture of the EU Cohesion policy, including inter alia the Just Transition Fund, or relevant support under the Recovery Plan for Europe or from the Technical Support Instrument. A special focus will be putted on skills as a driver for the development of the regions. Having a workforce with in-demand skills is important for long-term sustainable growth and competitiveness. It will also ensure that the green and digital transitions are socially fair and just.
Using media mix, the Project will illustrate and assess the role of Cohesion policy in delivering the EU’s political priorities and in addressing current and future challenges for the EU, Balkans, all regions in Bulgaria, cities and villages.
Several information measures that will illustrate and assess the role of Cohesion policy in delivering the European Commission’s political priorities  in all NUTS 2 6 regions in Bulgaria as well as in cross-border regions in Romania, Serbia, North Macedonia, Greece, and Turkey.
Keywords: media events; events; 3Dmapping; BTA; Balkans; skills

projects.TITLE: Bringing EU Cohesion Policy Closer to Citizens
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
SEM’s proposed awareness campaign will promote Cohesion Policy funding specifically and highlight key projects implemented in the territory of Malta. The campaign is intended to showcase real life stories where Cohesion Policy acted as a game changer in the life prospects of citizens.

TV will be one of the most widely used medium in SEM’s proposed awareness campaign, (specifically the evening news time band) followed by prime-time radio. The messages will be based on real-life stories and testimonials of beneficiaries of EU Cohesion Policy funds. These communication measures will be supplemented with bus shelter digital adverts, a publication to be distributed to all households in Malta and Gozo as well as a stakeholder conference.

Overall, the campaign will utilise both digital and print media, information in Maltese and English and incorporate in-person events. The latter allow for two-way communication during which target groups can have discussions with knowledgeable SEM staff, while the other outreach methods provide information to as wide an audience as possible, both to those who are internet literate or not, and Maltese or English speaking. The campaign content will insofar as possible be written in layman’s terms without too much technical jargon; further making the content accessible and engaging.  This is in line with the Clear writing initiative adopted by the European Commission.

The project’s specific objectives are:
• To develop and implement 1 promotional campaign on the added value of Cohesion policy and its impact in Malta through a number of activities including 10 videos which will be promoted on various media channels, 1,000 radio adverts, the publication and distribution of 1 publication, and the organisation of 1 national conference. 
• To increase citizens’ awareness of the results of Cohesion Policy in Malta. 
• To coordinate and manage this project and to disseminate the project and its results through a dissemination plan.

projects.TITLE: Cohesion4Climate
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective: Cohesion 4 Climate aims to boost positive EU identification and support among the citizens by: improving the media coverage on Cohesion Policy, particularly at regional level; focusing the contents on the tools that Cohesion Policy dispose to deal with climate and environmental challenges affecting the planet; informing journalists and scholars on the importance of a citizens-oriented communication; inspiring (under)graduate students to pursue a career as Projects Managers and public managers capable of investing European funds effectively and efficiently while respecting programming deadlines, . These goals will be achieved through a team of European journalists specialised in EU affairs, scholars and policy researchers and a marketing team dedicated to the project that will carry out the actions aimed to reach three specific objectives: (i) spread innovative multimedia contents developed by journalists and researchers; (ii) multiply the outreach of the consortium’s journalistic coverage in Italy and South-East Europe; and (iii) nurture the public debate on cohesion tools and practices among a transnational community of Italian and South-Eastern European stakeholders and civic watchdogs.

call_info.topic_description:
Expected Impact:

For the general public: increased public awareness of the results of Cohesion policy and their impact on citizens' lives to Europeans who are unaware of the EU and of the EU action in their region. Information should focus on developing greater understanding of the contribution of Cohesion policy to boosting jobs and growth in Europe and reducing disparities among Member States and regions.

For stakeholders: enhanced stakeholders’ engagement (including national, regional and local authorities, beneficiaries, businesses, academia) enabling them to further communicate the impact of Cohesion policy on their regions and to feed into the discussion on the future of Cohesion policy and, more broadly, the future of Europe.

Expected Outcome:
  • increased media coverage on Cohesion policy, in particular at regional level
  • enhanced people's awareness of the results of Cohesion policy and their impact on their lives
  • outputs and deliverables such as TV and radio broadcast, online or print coverage, other type of information measures and dissemination - taking multilingualism into account.
Objective:

The main aim of the call is to provide support for the production and dissemination of information and content linked to EU Cohesion policy, including inter alia the Just Transition Fund, or relevant support under the Recovery Plan for Europe or from the Technical Support Instrument.

The proposals should provide coherent, objective and comprehensive information, in order to give an accurate overall picture of the EU Cohesion policy. The proposals should illustrate and assess the role of Cohesion policy in delivering the EU’s political priorities and in addressing current and future challenges for the EU, its Member States, its regions and the local level.

Scope:

The geographical scope of this call is focussed on EU Member States, including overseas countries and territories (OCTs).

The information measures should include one or several activities such as:

  • production and distribution of print, multimedia or audiovisual material
  • web and social media outreach activities
  • media events
  • conferences, seminars, workshops.

projects.TITLE: European Regions: Partners for Sustainable Future
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
The project European Regions: Partners for Sustainable Future is presented by a consortium combining the regional policy stakeholders (Association of the Self-governing Regions, Association of Towns and Communities of Slovakia), research (Technical University of Kosice), and media organisation (EURACTIV Slovakia), supported by subcontracted media partners. 
The proposed project builds on the experience from previous regional policy communication projects implemented by the partners, adding innovative approaches that would incite the discussion about the future of the regional policy in the context of the EP elections, counter disinformation, and use the potential of social media, strengthening the impact of the communication actions. 
The proposed project uses a mix of online and offline communication actions, producing and disseminating information related to the EU Cohesion policy instruments, focusing on the implementation of the new structure of EU funds. Sustained online media coverage will be combined with the publication of social media content, cooperation with regional/local and national media, public events, and innovative activities for your audience (policy hackathon). All planned actions put emphasis on the involvement of regional policy stakeholders and the public. 
The activities target the general public, with a focus on young people, and stakeholders. Through cooperation with the network of media partners in other EU countries, communication action will reach a wider international audience. The estimated combined reach of the activities is 5M people receiving information. 
The project will be implemented during an important phase of the implementation of 2021-27 regional funding when traditional instruments are combined with the resources. At the same time, the impacts of the Russian aggression against Ukraine have created new challenges (energy costs, refugee crisis, economic recession) that could be faced with the help of the EU funding.

projects.TITLE: Czech Regions in Transition: Resilient to crises
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
The project seeks to raise the awareness of Czech citizens of the Cohesion policy as a tool that can help the Czech Republic and its regions in addressing current challenges. In a communication campaign that involves a group of national, regional, as well as EU media, project will show the real impacts of cohesion policy on citizens, explain links between EU political priorities and supported projects, and promote dialogue between national and regional stakeholders in order to stimulate the debate on the future of the policy.

The project involves communication activities that use power of the diverse set of media composed of leading national media brands as well as specialized media that are effectively addressing specific parts of our target groups such as EU policy professionals, national policymakers and stakeholders, or management of private and public organisations. We will address our audiences through a mix of activities that will be always tailored to their needs. The mix involves production of media content (written as well as audio-visual), promotion of the content among readers of respective media through their social media channels, and organization of various types of events that will welcome national, regional as well as local policymakers and stakeholders and make sure that their voice will be heard.
Keywords: Cohesion Czechia Czech cross-border events conference

projects.TITLE: Cohesion is us - Η συνοχή είμαστε εμείς
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
Media coverage for Cohesion in Cyprus is rather limited. Besides some official announcements by the beneficiaries or the Managing Authority only few news items can be found that clearly mention cohesion policy. When media are reporting on the implementation of key projects they do mention the EU funding but without any more details on the level of support, programme etc. 
Citizens seem to be unaware of the impact the policy has to their lives. According to the findings of the 2021 Eurobarometer 497 only 39% of the Cypriots asked knew at least one project in their area that was funded by EU funds.
Against this background the main objective of our project is to illustrate and assess the role of Cohesion policy in: delivering the EU’s political priorities, addressing current and new challenges and making sure that no region or city will be left behind. We want to support all efforts to communicate Cohesion by providing unbiased, objective, and easy to understand information to the Cypriots.
We will achieve this through a holistic media partnership that includes TV, radio, online media and events to ensure that targeted audiences will be approached in the best way, in the medium they prefer to consume news. In 12 months we will produce Sustained TV and online coverage of Cohesion, Multimedia, audio and online articles explainers, podcasts, music and knowledge radio contests, 3 events in Cyprus and 1 Brussels and an online library with handbooks for stakeholders.
Our aim is to improve awareness and knowledge of the citizens and stakeholders and inspire debates on the impact and the future of the policy. Informed citizens are resistant to misinformation and active stakeholders help to shape cohesion to better address the needs of the citizens.

The project has a confirmed collaboration with two EU countries: Finland and France. The weekly target audience is between one and two million viewers and listeners.

projects.TITLE: Will Togheter Across EU
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
According to the Youth Survey 2021 report which uses data collected during several opinion surveys on European youth (16-30 years old)  shows that:
• Young Europeans associate the EU with positive elements.
• When asked what the EU means to them, a majority (58%) of Europeans aged 16-30 link it to the freedom to travel, work and study anywhere in the EU;
• For 24% of young Europeans, climate change is one of the top three challenges the European Union is facing
Media consumption by young people is increasingly digital and 93% of young Europeans use the Internet on a daily basis. 
The use of social networks is one of the main factors of Internet consumption among young Europeans.
The Will Together Across Europe project will move precisely in this area.
Will Media is a media company with an online community of more than 2 million people, dedicated to inspiring change by generating awareness on the great issues of our time. Every month Will Media reaches over 10 million accounts altogether.
The Will Media community is made up of approximately 80% of young people between 18 and 35 years of age. the remaining 20% ​​are over 35 years old. 60% of the community is female.
During 2022 Will Media was among the leading social media with a growth of over 450,000 followers on Instagram alone with over 1.3 billion impression.
the general objective of the project will be to increase young people's awareness of the impact of cohesion policies on the daily life of citizens through the use of social media, in full line with the mission and editorial line of Will Media , which feeds the debate and insights on the most important social platforms every day, in constant constructive and dynamic dialogue with the reference generations: Generation Z and Millennials.
This objective appears even more relevant taking into account that the knowledge of cohesion policies among young Europeans is lower than the European average according to the latest Eurobarometer data.

projects.TITLE: #Deine regionale Zukunft
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
"We are proposing the #Deine regionale Zukunft (#DRZ) project in order to put the EU Cohesion policy on the agenda of secondary school education in Germany. Therefore, we will develop seminars for students and implement 15 events in secondary schools all over Germany. The #DRZ events will highlight the immediate impact of Cohesion policy on the everyday lives of students and their teachers. The events will have a strong focus on the regions or communities where they take place and investigate how the Cohesion fund instruments contribute to the development of the area. On top of that, the project will reach out to teachers and other multipliers through a newly developed Train-the-Trainer workshop which will be implemented in five schools or educational institutions all over Germany and enables them to implement #DRZ events themselves. Moreover, we will develop an online REGIO learning centre and material library containing material and information for multipliers to implement own sessions on Cohesion policy in schools.
The #DRZ events and the online REGIO learning centre and material library will come along with extensive dissemination work among our network of schools and political foundations as well as the “Europe Direct Network” in Germany. Additionally, local media will be invited to each the #DRZ school events to increase its outreach. Guests from the entrepreneurial and the political scene will be invited to the events to discuss the role of Cohesion funding for the respective regions. The project is going to exploit the finding of the H2020 project COHESIFY that awareness and appreciation of the Cohesion policy as the central act of European solidarity can importantly contribute to the development of a European Identity and the support of the European integration process. Eventually, the project will promote youngsters’ and teachers’ constructive attitude towards European politics by motivating them to take an active role in shaping our European future."

Deliverables.description: "The #Deine regionale Zukunft and other learning and teaching material on Cohesion policy will be published in the online REGIO learning centre and material library. It will be published in a downloadable format in templates and PowerPoint presentations. The material will be in German and will be translated to English to ensure the outreach to other students in European countries."

projects.TITLE: Creative Kingdom
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective: The Creative Kingdom project, carried out by AWATRON and Old-Continent, two Belgian actors committed to communicate local realities at European level,   aims at producing 10 portraits in a multimedia mini-series format to highlight the emerging creative talents in Wallonia and in Brussels-Capital Region while magnifying EU-funded projects.    The project will have a 12-month duration, during which it aims to bring young French-speaking Belgians (18-40 years old) closer to the realities fostered by the European Union in their local areas. In fact, surveys show that although Belgium is recognised as one of the most European states, young Belgians do not relate to this identity and are indeed very critical of the EU. Based on this observation the Creative Kingdom series aims to offer positive, engaging and empowering content to youth in Wallonia and Brussels, while highlighting the role that European institutions play in their future.  Each episode is conceived to be distributed via different channels. Each portrait will be presented in the form of an interview (written, photo and video), shared via social networks. Once finalized, the mini-series will also be exhibited in the context of a public event and issued in the form of a special number of SIROP magazine, distributed free of charge with a print run of 3,000 copies to 100+ addresses in Belgium. National media campaigns fed by AWATRON's network and digital marketing will be simultaneously put in place to ensure a resounding response to the series.

projects.TITLE: The Cohesion Story Quest
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
Cohesion Policy contributes to strengthening economic, social and territorial cohesion in the EU. But awareness of the EU Cohesion Policy achievements is still low across the member states.The biggest challenge nowadays is the way people consume and spread information and how stories cut through the noise, especially among the Generation Z cohort – the future of Europe.The Cohesion Story Quest project aims to explore alternative communication approaches in creating and spreading information about the Policy. It aims to open doors to reach new audiences with authentic content, created and shared by the most impactful channel, the one of the INFLUENCERS.The outreach campaign will combine two methodologies - alternative media channels,focusing on influencer marketing and social media,as well as traditional PR and digital, to generate extensive publicity around the project.
The Cohesion Story Quest will launch as a storytelling tribe on wheels, gathering travel influencers, journalists and bloggers on a road trip from Bulgarian to Portugal through Poland and The Netherlands.The “cohesion tribe” will consist of people from different backgrounds,different ages,culture,geographical areas, and/or with a wide variety of interests,such as social infrastructure,education,health,sustainability, equality, etc.The “cohesion tribe” will visit key places influenced by the Policy in the past and collect stories from the people and amplify them. The collected information will be transformed into a variety of stories – social media video stories, blog posts, media articles, interviews, etc.The tribe will share live content to create real time engagement with the target audience.Through promotion,engagement and gamification,we will drive people to read, participate and share the stories both via the media and also via the channels of the influencers involved. The Cohesion Policy stories will travel online in the 4 member states and the region raising awareness and building credibility.
Keywords: influencers; travel; storytelling; successful story sharing; road trip; exploration; Generation Z; engagement;

Deliverables.title: Story Quest Roarshow
Deliverables.description:
Story Quest Roarshow documented travel material.
Creating content with our video team and the influencers and uploading it to our press room and social media pages. The Story QUEST is a creative laboratory on wheels that will run for only 10 days. We will rent a comfortable van with necessary equipment and travel, accommodation and sustenance provided to the participants. THE UP project team will assist the influencers tribe in the content planning, developing, production, content support, post production and sharing: Planning: What projects, topics, content formats Story making: Interviews, reportages, video, text, visuals, IG stories etc Story sharing: Social media, Earned media, Paid media etc The influencers team will visit the 4 countries, meeting the cohesion project sites, talking to various preselected stakeholders, working together and creating and sharing amazing stories about the impact on Cohesion funded projects on people’s lives.

projects.TITLE: KOHEZIJA ZA VSE: s kohezijo do bolj socialne Evrope
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
The project proposal is based on understanding the relevance of information sharing and awareness building about the role EU Cohesion policy has on the lives of Europeans. Collaboration between youth organization ZA in PROTI, national television RTV Koper-Capodistria and non-governmental organisation PiNA will create and spread information about the Cohesion policy, and especially ESF+, and thus provide much-needed context to main target groups and individuals. 

The project proposal is based on two successful implementations (GREEN Cohesion and GREEN Cohesion for YOUTH) and an understanding of the defined target groups. It joins communication and educational efforts, in order to inform and raise the involvement of target groups. Communication efforts will result in 20 television reportages for established TV shows, 2 new documentaries, 1 new talk show and invite 4 representatives of good practices, financed by the Cohesion policy in the widely- watched morning television show in Slovenia (Dobro jutro). Communication and media activities will also include a wide communication campaign and digital campaign on RTV MMC portal. Educational efforts will be focused on student debates and public consultations with key stakeholders. Informational material and training will be prepared for teachers-mentors, and 4 2-day national debate tournaments will be organized for elementary and secondary school students. 

During its duration, the proposed project will connect partner organizations, strengthen the understanding of cohesion policy among the target groups and enable the active participation of directly involved young people. In the long term, however, with enhanced information and an increased understanding of cohesion policy, Europeans can use their voice and knowledge to improve EU community policies, which is a key factor in the success and health of our common European democracy.

projects.TITLE: Cohesion Weekly
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
“Cohesion Weekly” aims to contribute to a better understanding of the EU Cohesion policy by European citizens thanks to a verified, neutral and popularized information campaign that will contribute to strengthening their sense of belonging to the EU. This information campaign will demonstrate how the European cohesion policy implements the EU's political priorities by being one of the main drivers of European integration, and how its operations contribute to addressing the challenges faced by the EU at national, regional and local level. France Médias Monde (FMM) and its affiliated entity RFI România propose to tackle this issue by informing European citizens about the role and impact of the EU Cohesion policy on their daily lives. In order to achieve this objective, FMM and RFI România will implement a transmedia and multilingual (FR, EN, RO) information campaign based on the production and broadcast of innovative audiovisual content to EU citizens to break down the role and impact of the Cohesion policy on their daily lives, and how it adapts to the many challenges the EU is facing by providing concrete examples of Cohesion projects in 18 EU countries, including 3 outermost regions. FMM and RFI România will carry out 3 WPs:  
- Produce radio reports and web articles in French covering topics of EU’s Cohesion Policy such as cross-border cooperation in health, peace, energy and climate change resilience across EU and the Outermost regions (WP2)
- Produce TV magazines, long reports and fact-or-fake modules, in French and in English, explaining the EU Cohesion policy and how it is adapting to the various challenges of the post-Covid world and the return of war on the European continent (WP3)
- Produce radio reports, videos and infographics in Romanian to raise Romanian citizens’ awareness of the Cohesion policy, and particularly the EU Strategy for the Danube Region (WP4)
The results achieved by our project will potentially target 1.8 million people across Europe.
Keywords: radio; TV; social networks; media; cohesion; information; EU citizens

projects.TITLE: A set of customized Information Measures to raise awareness of EU cohesion policy among citizens in depopulated areas and successful results to turn citizens into active agents
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective: "The #CohesionLabEU project aims to raise awareness of the importance and contribution of EU cohesion policy and to address current and future challenges in Spanish territories undergoing depopulation, and its results can be extended to other European territories with the same depopulation problem. The project will create a ""learning community"" specifically designed for the particularities and sensitivities of the citizens of these territories, carrying out communication, awareness-raising and promotion campaigns on cohesion policy using specific tools and messages for the ""losers"" of the processes of globalisation, which are the inhabitants of rural areas far from urban areas. In this way, the project will raise the visibility of cohesion policy actions, objectives, strategies, planning, instruments and funds in these territories, increasing support for the European construction process and facilitating more and better use of funds to boost sustainable growth and reduce the specific disparities. The slogan of the project will be ""Here we are, EU”, to emphasize the fact that the inhabitants of European territories at risk of depopulation contribute to the process of European integration and that their activities and businesses contribute to improving the quality of life of citizens in the 276 regions of the EU."

projects.Objective:
The proposed project with title EUHeyday The EU Cohesion Policy shapes my daily life will undertake activities which will bolster the knowledge of Cypriot citizens for the EU Cohesion Policy, and its three main funds, including the Recovery Plan for Europe. the Just Transition Fund and the Technical Support Instrument. This will be mainly achieved through the activities of the Work Packages 2, 3 and 4 and specifically through: the use of traditional and digital media awareness – raising campaigns (Radio spots and interviews, use of social media and Google Display Network, use of influences, create podcasts and story leads); the out of home activities such as the EU Cohesion Policy Fun Run and the development of the Brain and Treasure Hunt virtual game and the organisation of 3 trainings and one open dialogue for stakeholders.The specific objectives, which apply horizontally to the proposed actions, are to: foster a better understanding of the role of the EU Cohesion policy, the Recovery Plan for Europe and the Just Transition Fund, in supporting Cyprus, highlight and indicate projects in Cyprus which were funded through the EU’s Cohesion policy and the Recovery Plan for Europe and the importance of these projects on the everyday life of the Cypriot citizens; create an understanding and encourage an open dialogue on EU Cohesion policy, its results and its role on achieving the political priorities of the EU and its future; foster and encourage civic participation on issues related to EU Cohesion policy and citizens’ participation for identifying the future priorities of the EU Cohesion policy;
encourage civic participation on European Union’s issues in general and make Cypriot citizens, feel like EU Citizens. Additionally, the proposed project will support and boost the knowledge of Cyprus citizens regarding the Technical Support Instrument’s objectives and results.The target audience which the abovementioned actions will focus at, is the general public in Cyprus an

projects.TITLE: HOTSTOP-Young people discover the Cohesion Policy and act against climate change
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
HOTSTOP is a project completed to give visibility to the EU Cohesion Fund policy, with special interest in the Just Transition Fund, since Galicia is one of the territories most affected by the transition towards climate neutrality.
For this, we will create a network of 10 local radio stations, in 10 secondary education institutes in Galicia, managed by and for young people, who will be the main protagonists of the project and of all the planned activities.
After receiving initial training on Cohesion Policy and the Just Transition Fund, participants will receive specific training on how to set up a web radio and a Twitch channel, thanks to our experience as an organization active at a European level in podcast and video broadcasting. (Projects Broadcasting Europe 2017-3-IT03-KA205-012236 and One Radio 2019-2-ES02-KA205-013843).
Finally, the participants will receive training on digital tools, storytelling techniques and assertive communication, as well as strategies for effective communication and dissemination.
Once they have participated in the training activities, the young participants will make up their teams and divide roles and tasks to set up their web radios and Twitch channels, with the aim of identifying issues related to Cohesion policy and the Just Transition Fund, contact policy makers, civil society representatives and activists, and organize podcasts and streaming to publicize these programs and initiatives, while conducting journalistic research.
Starting from the analysis of the needs and own competences, we have recognized the following objectives:

-Value the role of European institutions and policies, with special emphasis on Cohesion policy and the Just Transition Fund
-Promote the active participation of young people in the processes of civic monitoring and democratic life;
-Build bridges between the business world, the educational world and that of political institutions, which allow educational exchange and improve the quality of initiatives

projects.TITLE: Connected, Inclusive, Green, Smart EU –  Cohesion Trends
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
Cohesion policy is one of the main drivers of development, but only a small percentage of EU citizens know what Cohesion policy means and what impact it has on their lives and their environment.  Therefore we designed a strong media consortium with a greater audience reach and with an intention to produce and disseminate information linked to EU Cohesion policy and raise public awareness about its impact on their lives. 
 TV Idea – kanal 10 is main TV broadaster in Pomurje and covers more than 40.000 households. Partner Mariborinfo d.o.o. with media outlets Sobotainfo.com, Mariborinfo.com, Ptujinfo.com, Ljubljanainfo.com covers specific regions in Slovenia and has a reach of more than 258.000 visitors per day and more than 1.300.000 readers per month. Styria media.si d.o.o. operates with one of the largest national online media and has an expert team of social media communication for youth generation. Žurnal24 is an informative media outlet with monthly reach of 700.000 users, Joongla operates as Youtube, TikTok and Instagram channel for younger audience (more than 58.000 Youtube subscribers). Starševski čvek is the largest online forum in Slovenia with more than 60.000 daily visitors. With project activities we will provide information about CP, enable a more informed debate about future priorities for the EU and on the way that funding should be used. General public and specific stakeholders will get a better insight on impact of Cohesion Policy and its support regarding job creation, business competitiveness, economic growth, sustainable development and improve citizens quality of live across EU regions.
We will implement a project from Nov 2023 until Oct 2024 and produce 24 videos – 60 seconds personal stories, 12 TV shows, 41 media outlets articles with social media posts and organise 4 events for specific target group. We will reach at least 400.000 views of press releases (digital media) and at least 50.000 views of personal stories and TV shows.

projects.TITLE: Cohesion and the new funding opportunities: time for results
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
“Time4Results” is an information measure to to produce and disseminate information on the overall EU Cohesion policy in Italy, with a special attention to the new instruments of 2021-27 programming and the synergies between regional funds and the National Recovery Plan. 
In recent years, Cohesion policy faced multiple challenges triggered by the economic consequences of the COVID pandemics and the war in Ukraine. The Cohesion framework has proven flexibility to respond to those crises while preserving the long-term and structural characteristics of its intervention.
In the next two years new challenges will need to be addressed, as the 2014-2020 programming will close and the 2021-2027 programming will become fully operational, with great relevance for Italian society at every level, as Italy is a top-beneficiary of both 2021-27 Cohesion funds and NGEU.
There are, however, major Italians’ awareness gaps concerning Cohesion and the related issues:
•	a general, significant, lack of recognition of the policy benefits; 
•	dramatic low levels of understanding and appreciation of the policy from the young generations
Against this background The Consortium of “Time4Results” proposes a multi-level and multi-targeted information measure with a special focus on the impact and results of Cohesion policy.
“Time4Results” leverages on diverse layers of action to inform, raise awareness and participation of stakeholders, academics, media professionals, and citizens, especially young ones. 
The information measure includes: a dedicated two-tiered newsfeed delivered to local and national media, and directly to citizens; academic reports; online and in-presence forums with stakeholders’ participation; multimedia tools to make complex information more accessible; activities on the ground to mobilize young citizens. To support that general approach, the measure will also provide information on the results of Cohesion policy in other EU territories, beyond the local context.

projects.TITLE: Energy 4 Future
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
Energy4Future aims to boost positive EU identification and EU support among the citizens by:  improving the media coverage on Cohesion policy, in particular at regional level; focusing the contents on the tools that Cohesion Policy dispose to afford the energy crisis; sensitizing journalists and scholars on the importance of a citizens-oriented communication. These goals will be achieved through a team of European journalists specialised on Eu affairs, researchers of Issirfa-Cnr and a marketing team dedicated to the project that will carry out the actions aimed to reach three specific objectives: spread innovative multimedia contents developed by journalists and researchers, multiple the outreach of the consortium’s journalistic coverage in Italy and South-East Europe, nurture the debate on cohesion tools and practices among a transnational community of Italian and South-Eastern European stakeholders and watchdogs. 
The multidisciplinary and multi-stakeholder composition of the Consortium will aim at ensuring that the envisaged activities will reach the target groups, represented by citizen, also young people, journalists and stakeholders.

projects.TITLE: Europe on Balkans: Cohesion future
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
The general objective of the proposed action is implementation of several information  measures that will illustrate and assess the role of Cohesion policy in delivering the   European Commission’s political priorities in order to support job creation, business competitiveness, economic growth, sustainable development, and improve citizens' quality of life in all six NUTS2  regions in Bulgaria and on Balkans and addressing current and future challenges for the European union with a special focus on the local audiences.
The specific objectives of the proposed action are:
To promote and foster a better understanding of the role of Cohesion policy in Bulgaria and cross-border regions on Balkans
To increase awareness of projects funded by the EU through Cohesion policy and of their impact on people's lives with special focus on the local communities.
To disseminate information and encourage an open dialogue on Cohesion policy, its  results on local level.
To encourage civic participation in matters related to Cohesion policy and to foster citizens' participation to setting priorities for the future of this policy.
To raise public awareness of the results of Cohesion policy and their impact on  citizens' lives to Europeans who are unaware of the EU and of the EU action in their region. 
To engage with stakeholders (including national, regional and local authorities, beneficiaries, businesses, academia) to further communicate the impact of Cohesion  policy on their regions and to feed into the discussion on the future of Cohesion policy  and, more broadly, the future of Europe.
In order to achieve the general and specific objectives, BTA plans to use media mix, including innovation measures as virtual reality and gamification, as well as  omnichannel media strategy  with the goal of creating a  consistent experience and assess the role of Cohesion policy in  in delivering the EC’s political priorities on local audiences.

Deliverables.title: 1 year licence for VR platform
Deliverables.description:
Self-service platform for creating events in Virtual reality with intuitive interface that will captivate the audience and will be 24/7 availabl. 
Innovative All-in-one platform appealing digital environments and 3D avatar models, possibility to embed professional presentation of content with a layer of direct communication channels and gamification elements. The state of the art technical solutions of the digital platform are sustainable and offer high-quality webcast streams, intuitive peer-to-peer networking, workshops, and creative product presentations.
The platform will offer auditorium streams, interactive chats, video calls, and gamification elements. Workshops, group discussions and virtual networking lounges via the integrated video conferencing solution will create a shared sense of community. Virtual show booths and virtual showrooms will be the space to present regions details, successful projects, videos, documents, or current calls openings. Booths will give the opportunity to effectively highlight and share information, this includes video screen integration and media libraries that allow downloads within the digital event. Live chats will allow visitors to communicate directly with the booth personnel via text or video in public or private room. The auditorium of a digital event is a virtual space for lectures, symposia, discussions and panels. These presentations will take place in the form of videos and webcast integrations into the platform. Live streams can be broadcast as webcasts from BTA studio or directly from the stage of a corresponding on-location event. Pre-recorded videos or webcasts can be integrated into the platform and “premiere” at a specific time according to the conference agenda. Platform will offer possibility for integration of a panel discussion, and a multiple webcam webcast can be used. The virtual event will be followed by an on-demand period which makes all the video and exhibition content available for another month.

Deliverables.title: 1 hybrid Opening event in Sofia
Deliverables.description:
2 days hybrid conference will bring together in BTA’s multi media center in  Sofia  around 60 people and will be broadcasted via Innovative virtual reality platform (with an option for a large number of people to participate: speaking and/or sending messages) and linked to the BTA’s YouTube channel and Facebook page to reach thousands of people. 
The agenda of the conference will present the frame of the EU Cohesion policy, including the Just Transition Fund and the recovery plan for Europe.
Information about Cohesion policy’s Funds priorities (The European Regional  Development Fund; The European Social Fund+; The Just Transition Fund and  The Interreg programmes) will be provided on separate virtual boots and discussed during the conference.
Speakers from the national authorities that are responsible for implementation of the Cohesion policy’s Funds priorities in Bulgaria will be involved in the conference as well as  representative of other European member states who will present good practises in haw Cohesion is implemented in their countries and successful project funded by the European  Regional Development Fund; The European Social Fund+; and The Interreg programmes during previous programming period.
Working group sessions are organised, to discuss and endorse the 5 policy objectives  supporting growth for the period 2021-2027: a more competitive and smarter Europe; a  greener, low‑carbon transitioning towards a net zero carbon economy; a more connected  Europe by enhancing mobility; a more social and inclusive Europe; Europe closer to citizens  by fostering the sustainable and integrated development of all types of territories in a  specially created virtual rooms.
As Panellists and moderators will be involved leaders and decision influencers.
Promotional materials branded with EU logo will be distributed during each of the event.
Catering will be ordered.

Deliverables.title: 6 hybrid Regional events in Bulgaria
Deliverables.description:
Regional events, covering the 6th The North-West, North-Central, North-East, South-West, South-East and South-Central regions will be organized in Vidin, Ruse, Varna, Burgas, Plovdiv and Blagoevgrad.
Each event will be adapted to the needs of the concerned regions and will be hosted  in cooperation with local authorities, partners, and universities in each of the cities.
The events will be held in BTA press clubs. Online connections with our press clubs  in Serbia and North Macedonia will be done to engage in the discussions and to  present successful projects funded by Interreg programmes.
The link between the topic for discussion and the location will be carefully selected with the ultimate goal to meet the interest of the local people and thedevelopment of the regions. The discussion will be not only locally focused, but it will  be aiming at a national and international outreach and will via livestreaming in Zoom, You Tube and Facebook.
The main focus will be on Citizens at the heart of the policy and Boosting growth  and jobs. Cohesion policy’s Funds priorities (The European Regional Development  Fund; The European Social Fund+; The Just Transition Fund and  The Interreg programmes) will be discussed with special focus on haw they impact specific regions.
Special focus of the discussions will be putted on the contribution of Cohesion policy to boosting jobs and growth in Europe and reducing disparities among Member States and regions.
Stakeholders (including national, regional and local authorities, beneficiaries, businesses, academia) will be engaged to further communicate the impact of Cohesion policy on their regions=
Promotional materials branded with EU logo will be distributed during each of the events.
Catering will be ordered for each of the events.

Deliverables.title: 1 International closing conference in Sofia
Deliverables.description:
International closing conference in Albena – a two days hybrid event using the interactive digital platform taking place online and at the National Press center of BTA. It will be open to the public and will be livestreamed on BTA webpage and social media pages.
The Closing Conference will provide discussion on the key findings and outcomes 
of the project, including the specifics of each of the 6 NUTS 2 regions in Bulgaria

projects.TITLE: Transition opportunities
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
General objective of the TRANSITION OPPORTUNITIES project is to promote the contribution of EU cohesion policy, Just Transition Fund, and Recovery Plan for Europe to ensure smooth and just transition to a climate-neutral economy of BG regions to be most affected by the transformation. 
Activities: 6 local awareness-raising events to promote and showcase positive results of cohesion policy (CP) measures in the NUTS3 territories of Kyustendil, Pernik & Stara Zagora. Policy experts and beneficiaries will discuss on EU priorities addressing climate change and environmental protection, thus allowing the audience to understand the logic of the transition and most importantly the opportunities available.
1 webinar for entrepreneurs, brave investors, and innovators at national and international level to discuss about diversification of local economic life.
1 international forum /100 participants will foster interregional cooperation with other EU territories affected by green transition. Hundreds of publications in own and external media channels. 
1 public survey on citizens` level of awareness on CP & transition opportunities at regional level. It will engage citizens in assessing opportunities and reflect on positive outcomes.
1 mapping of EU-funding supported success stories - to increase visibility of CP in project`s regions & demonstrate positive impact on citizens’ lives.
15 podcasts - successful beneficiaries tell stories about project experience and inspire audiences to unfold potential of CP financial instruments.
Intense digital media activity to maximise visibility of successful projects, involving local influencers in disseminating project results and green transition messages.
3 social media challenges to engage citizens producing before and after content related to projects, thus recalling positive CP impact. By sharing photos and videos they will become active content creators for the project while at the same time get involved in setting future priorities

projects.TITLE: #CoesioneItalia. L'Europa vicina
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
The project’s broad objective is to effectively inform a wide audience about the EU Cohesion policy with: a journalism information campaign (integrated multiplatform dissemination strategy) and an awareness campaign (public events).
Domani, the media partner, will work closely with the lead partner scientific experts, inform and communicate the project’s events through articles, editorials, insights, by means of a multi-platform dissemination strategy (printed and digital newspaper, social media). Maps and infographics will sum up the results of the debates. Social media will be used specifically to encourage a broad public engagement, on the positive impact of the projects promoted by the cohesion policy. Citizens will be involved in the debate by stories on Instagram quizzes, Twitter polls and live Facebook events featured by the cohesion policy experts and by the actors in the virtuous cohesion projects.
Fondazione Basso (FB), will manage the project and its scientific experts will build its backbone contents. FB experts will map a set of outstanding “cohesion” projects and will present them during 8 local events in 8 Italian areas (L’Europa vicina. I territori si raccontano). Stakeholders and citizens will debate, delve into the topics, raise knowledge and awareness on the EU cohesion policy results. The events will mix an evidence-based data approach and the emotional storytelling by the leading project actors or the targeted beneficiaries. The final 3-day event in Rome, Maratona Europa, at national level, will involve a wide audience in a collective and participatory mode and have a significant multiplier effect for the communication of the cohesion policy’s effects. All events will be both in attendance and streamed, to reach relevant target groups. Final reports and an e-poster, as a memento for the main cohesion issues, will sum up the beneficiaries’ perception of the ongoing EU cohesion policy and will be tools for further debates in any project to come.
Keywords: Coesione; Italia; Europa; Just transition; inequalities; communication.

projects.TITLE: Europa Info1 - informational point for relevant cohesion topics
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
Project Studio EUROPA 2.0 is designed as the interactive mobile information-educational studio that will bring citizens closer to various topics related to the European Union, the idea of Regional and Cohesion policy and its impact on everyday life. A wide range of activities such as interactive educational workshops, meetups, showing and distribution of short and long videos, audio works - radio shows, web and social media articles and journalistic articles is an idea to encourage citizens to actively participate in thinking about and getting to know the EU and Cohesion policies.The innovativeness of the project is reflected in the use and redefining of the purpose of social spaces such as cinemas in places of informing and educating citizens about the European Union. Special emphasis was placed on the participation of young people, groups of citizens and residents in rural parts of Croatia who are already finding it difficult to access information through modern technologies. 

The planned activities are grouped and elaborated into four categories: WP.0. Project management, WP.1. Knowledge-sharing workshops, WP.2. Awareness raising campaign- Community interventions and active citizens and WP.3. Visibility of EU funding.
The implementation of the project will take place in the Karlovac County, Ličko-senjska County, Primorsko-goranska County, City of Zagreb, Zagreb County, Sisak-moslavina County, Istarska County and Zadarska County area. Part of the activities will include EU member states in the region (Central Europe) in a way that through the planned audiovisual and TV content bring the target group and the wider regional and local community examples of good practice in the preparation and implementation of EU projects, Cohesion policy and other relevant topics and their contribution to improving the quality of life of the EU citizens.
Keywords: production and distribution of short and long videos

projects.TITLE: Cohesion Policy is standing by Cyprus, France and Belgium!
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
The proposed project is an awareness raising campaing aiming to inform people in three different Member States (i.e. Cyprus, France and Belgium) about: (i) Cohesion Policy; (ii) its priorities and funds; (iii) projects funded through Cohesion Policy accross all three partner countries/regions; and (iv) Cohesion Policy's contribition in  promoting a more inclusive, sustainable, green, connected and closer to the citizens European Union. 
To this goal, the project team will implement a comprehensive awareness raising campaign through both new and traditional media as well as engage with several stakeholders across all three different regions participating in the project. Thus, during the project implementation, diversified content will be created, including a web-tv show with street art elements (e.g. graffiti), animation videos, posters, online publications, e-banners social media posts, podcasts, and interviews. The goal will be to make people engage with the campaign and gain valuable knowledge about Cohesion Policy and its pivotal contribution in the improvement of EU citizens' lives. Additionally, a series of events (i.e. workshops, living labs and focus groups) will be implemented in order for the project to engage with both relevant stakeholders and people and make them participate in an open discussion on Cohesion Policy, its priorities and its future. A report will be drafted at the end of the events, including the results, considerations and ideas collected in all three partner regions.

projects.TITLE: Korzyści z funduszy unijnych wokół Ciebie, bliżej niż myślisz !
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
"The main objective of the project is to raise awareness about the impact of the European Cohesion Policy and the impact of its effects on everyday quality of life among the part of Polish society, that is the least aware of this impact (elderly people, people living in small towns, people with maximum secondary education), in particular in terms of impact in their immediate vicinity (region and the local community).
 
The goal will be achieved by:

1. Annual cross-media editorial campaign ""Stop exclusion of seniors"" using elements of intergenerational education and “Crosswords with European funds” reaching nearly 473,000 monthly press readers aged 55+; 4.5 million radio listeners aged up to 39,

2. Dedicated press supplements ""Get know your region - stay around"" describing the possibilities of using various social services as well as the cultural and entertainment offer in immediate surrounding and region, which will be contacted by over 7 million readers and 400 thousand unique users,

3. Regional, cross-sectional press publications across the country ""EU cohesion policy in your region"" which will be contacted by over 7 million readers,

4. Videos carried out in cooperation with an influencer (recognizable editor) focused on increasing awareness of practical solutions offered by EU funds, which can have a real impact on improving the socio-economic situation of the project target groups.
 
The objectives of the project and its activities are relevant to this ""Call” by focusing on:

1. Building awareness of EU Regional Policy among the least aware groups,

2. Showing the impact of the EU Cohesion Policy in the immediate environment, applying the effects of using EU funds in everyday activities,

3. Emphasizing the fact that the presence of EU funds and its effects in Poland have a real impact on the quality of life and the socio-economic situation of groups that are unaware of this impact and they are at the same time the most vulnerable on economic crisis."

projects.TITLE: Europe on Tuscany Mountain
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
The proposal intends to bring Europe - and its opportunities - closer to municipalities, associations and enterprises in the mountain and inner territories of Tuscany Region. By definition, these areas are the most deprived in terms of primary services (like transports, schools, health), with essential public administrative functions that have been relentlessly reduced in the last two decades and difficulty in grasping information and opportunities descending from the European Union. 
We will activate three onsite and online EU Antennae for information and advice on EU cohesion policies and opportunities. The project foresees robust information on EU cohesion policies and opportunities, disseminated through emails, mobile apps or videos, which are continuously amplified through social networks and other promotion material. Twenty training courses are provided on EU policies and opportunities. Awareness raising and public discussion in EU cohesion policies affecting peripheral areas is stimulated through the existing EU mountain forum, where Mayors participate also in the direct promotion of EU policies and opportunities.
Keywords: mountain development funds europe inner peripheral office

projects.TITLE: The Newsroom 27
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
"""The Newsroom 27"" is a unique European journalistic initiative aimed to draw-up a panorama of EU cohesion policy, by bringing together 27 young journalists from across the EU. For 27 days, they will build a trans-European ephemeral newsroom, look for emblematic initiatives developed throughout the Union, and write 27 articles that will be published in three languages.

Our goal: 
We want to contribute to a better understanding by European citizens of what the EU cohesion policy is, its impact on the life of their region and on their daily lives, and raise their awareness of the importance of this policy. 
Our initiative targets the 25-49 year olds, a public directly concerned by the effects of European policies, in the short, medium or long term.

The way to achieve it: 
To enable the general public to grasp the stakes of European policy, we will tell them these stories they don't know: How the Union has helped transform the department where they live? How has this neighbor been able to develop this project to safeguard the environment? How were these scientists supported in their research project?

We will launch a call for applications, open to all young European journalists under 30. The 27 selected journalists will join The Newsroom 27, our ephemeral trans-European newsroom. 

The 27 articles will be published on 3 media: 
- on our mainstream website Slate.fr, in French
- on the website Thenewsroom27.eu, in 3 languages: french, native language of the journalist and english
- and on a European media partner, in the local language, or on a French media partner, depending on the region covered by the article. 

Our media plan aims at amplifying the diffusion of contents to our target audience, through four axes: 
- at the national level in France (Slate.fr)
- at the regional level in France (online regional press) 
- at the European level (local media)
- on social networks

Estimated impact:
12.5 million impressions in France
12.5 million impressions in Europe"
Keywords:
trans-european journalistic initiative 
27 young journalists from across the European Union
27 articles published in 3 languages

projects.TITLE: A BRAVE NEW EUROPE - VOYAGER
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
A Brave New Europe - Voyager is a slow journalism project, available on different platforms. The goal is to reach and engage communities as diverse as possible, to correctly inform about the measures of the European cohesion policy, their effects, and how these measures impact people's life.

The audiences of these contents will be invited to converse and interact with the Slow News editorial team that coordinates the project, to consolidate the bond with interested people, and consolidate the relationship of trust and transparency which is the basis of good journalism.

Long-forms, videos and digital stories disseminated in different formats, comic journalism, podcasts and radio programs, interactive maps, newsletters, live and on demand events are part of the editorial project.
A Brave New Europe - Voyager is based on what we have learned and on the foundations built in previous editions of the project, with which we won the similar grant (A Brave New Europe in 2021, A Brave New Europe - Next Generation in 2022). Also in this edition we add partners and formats for disseminating content, always choosing them on the basis of common values and to reach a varied audience.

A Brave New Europe - Voyager therefore integrates the experience and communities of Slow News and Percorsi di secondo welfare (working together since 2021) with those of Internazionale (an historical Italian weekly magazine), Zai.net (free press for young people, also written by students) and the Revue Dessinee Italia (an innovative quarterly based on comics journalism). This year there will also be an historic Italian radio (Radio Popolare) and an international dissemination of contexts and perspectives thanks to Le Grand Continent, which will translate, adapt and disseminate content in French, German, Spanish and Polish.

Last but not least, A Brave New Europe - Voyager has another objective: to consolidate a working method where all the people who collaborate feel safe and respected.

projects.TITLE: EU FACTOR Next - For a cohesive, sustainable and fair Europe
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
"EUFACTORNEXT aims to inform citizens and increase their awareness on the role of cohesion policy in regional development and in improving their quality of life.
The project will develop from the Emilia-Romagna area but have a national and European character: the dissemination of communication products will involve the entire national territory. Furthermore, the European stories (WP2 ""Euro-Rail""), produced by young journalists in 8 EU countries, give the project a wide and interconnected character.
The project includes various communication activities with diversified tools. In particular, some activities (Euro-Rail -WP2, Cohesion Pills -WP 3-4) envisage different means of communication to bring the same contents to different targets: local TV /radio are aimed at all citizens, while podcasts, social media, and web are aimed rather at a younger audience. Other activities, such as the RadUni podcasts (WP4), specifically target university students. Finally, the events (WP5) have above all the objective of actively involving stakeholders, in particular businesses and young people, in the debate on the role of cohesion policy and on the future of Europe. Furthermore, the target enterprises will actively participate in all phases of the project, mostly constituting the subject of the narration and it will be directly involved.
The partnership already consolidated and tested by the EU FACTOR project, the variety of tools used (TV, radio, podcasts, social media, web sites, online and face-to-face events), the use of effective dissemination networks, such as the Europe Direct network, they are the best guarantee of success of the project.
The main expected results are: an increased knowledge and awareness of the people reached; an increased awareness of companies to be able to develop projects; dissemination of good practices, starting from virtuous projects and territories; an active participation of businesses and young people in the debate on cohesion policy and Europe."
