projects.TITLE: YOUTH FOR GREEN EURO REGIO FUTURE
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
Youth for green Euro Regio Future is a personalized, multilingual, online and off-line Euroregional communication campaign project on EU cohesion policy. It is created by and for youth and built upon the long-lasting territorial cooperation between the 3 member regions of the Euroregion Pyrenees Mediterranean/EPM (Region Occitanie /FR, Generalitat of Catalonia and Government of the Balearic Islands /ES). By a consortium of 6 partners representing governments, local entities, universities and youth entities from the EPM territory and experienced hosting structures of EU communication networks, Y4 GREEN ERF tackles the 5 priorities of the 2021-2027 Cohesion Policy to enhance people's awareness of EU regional policy results and impact on citizens’ lives and on the Euroregional territory’s sustainable development. The campaign’s main focus is on the greener Europe priority: the EPM has 35 land, marine and coastal natural areas. Its main target is young people including those with fewer opportunities (vocational training, second chance schools or young migrants).
Y4-GREEN-ERF, through a network of proximity media, original and wide communication channels (mini-documentaries, picture videos, social networks) adapts to a Euroregional approach the most relevant themes of the European Green Deal (adaptation to climate change, preservation of the environment and biodiversity…), subjects that go beyond borders and capitalizes the existing best practices.  
The project actions to be implemented, complementing the EPM Road Map 2021-2030, will be co-constructed in a bottom up dynamics and adapted to the reality of each territory of the EPM, using its 4 different languages (Catalan, Spanish, French, Occitan). Off line, at least 15 Euroregional events and a Euroregional Youth Forum are planned.
Y4-GREEN-ERF expects to impact 50,000 Euroregional citizens and directly involve 1,000 young people, taking advantage of the recently created Euroregional Youth Assembly.
Keywords: Bottom-up communication participation assembly environment governance proximity press social media interregional international Balearic Islands Catalonia Occitania Pyrenees Mediterranean web inclusion

projects.TITLE: AwareEU? Achieve Wide Awareness of  EU REsults
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
The AwareEU (AwareEU Achieve Wide Awareness of EU REsults) project’s general objective is the production and dissemination of contents and analysis of information related to the impact of Cohesion policy in Italy and the Italian Recovery Plan, which are strictly connected in terms of objectives and outcomes in the long run, and their effects on the life of citizens. The developed content will inform citizenry and civil society organizations about the objectives, the functioning and practical results of Cohesion policies and related funds, contributing to reducing the gap existing between European institution and citizenry. 
Specific case studies will dig into Italian projects funded by 2014-2020 Cohesion funds and their impact and will aim at promoting an approach to the production, dissemination and reading of data and information related to the use of EU funds and the effects on citizens life. They will be told by journalists starting from technical data available on the Monithon platform as collected by citizens themselves through civic monitoring activities. Under the supervision and coaching of info.nodes, young journalists will exploit data journalism and storytelling methods to develop and adapt that content for the large public. Data will speak further also through onData experience in infographics and data visualisation. The communication approach from citizens who collected data to citizens who will read and listen their stories will be further developed also through a podcast which will be led by ActionAid IT, exploiting its experience in large public communication which is centred around people and their stories of change.

projects.TITLE: European Solidarity
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
The EUsolidarity project will provide comprehensive coverage of Cohesion policy. The reports will cover the priority areas of cohesion fund spending, as well as their use in specific regions, and examples of 
good practices.
The project involves a multi-media strategy. Therefore, its outputs will be:
- A weekly service of about 5 minutes on Cohesion Policy for about 42 services over the course of the project.This will be included in the television program “VEDIAMOCI CHIARO”, broadcasted on TV 2000 at 10:30 a.m. (and a nightly replay at 4:35 a.m.), and on the radio program “Al vostro servizio”, broadcasted on Radio in Blu at 6:30 p.m.

- A monthly section (about 20 minutes) in the TV program SIAMO NOI, aired on TV2000 at 3:15 p.m. and a nightly repeat at 1:10 a.m. and again at 1:40 a.m.
- A weekly mention of Cohesion policy in the radio program Buongiorno In Blu, aired on Radio InBlu every morning.
- Relaunch on EURACTIV Italy of all videos and podcasts, plus an EURACTIV Italy monthly newsletter on Cohesion Policy, including link to that month outputs and other 
articles by EURACTIV on Cohesion Policy. 
- Rete Blu will also involve the Iniziative Editoriali srl (Icaro TV), which brings together a number of regional and local television stations, in the production of reports on 
cohesion policy in the various regions, to be used in broadcasts and reruns.
Considering the current audience of the TV and Radio programs, and media and social media involved, the project shall reach at least 6.200.000 people.

projects.TITLE: Experts' selection of the most distinguished projects executed with the help of the EU Cohesion funds in three countries of the Pannonian basin and their comprehensive media promotion.
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective: The power of an argument in general increases proportionate to its persuasiveness based on clearly evident logical precepts. This seems to be an obvious and self-evident statement, although it is not. Especially in the field of mass-media one gets the impression that especially in the last decades – more than ever before – Machiavellian principle of ends justifying the means became the ruling principle. One only needs to call into its mind the ever-growing flood of fake-news, which is getting something of a new normality not only in the social media, but, unfortunately, also in the mainstream media. Thus, it does not come as a surprise that among the best rated media products are TV documentaries as the audience still trust the information, provided in these documentaries, to be the most valid and true. Therefore, the decision to present the case of the most distinguished projects executed with the help of the EU Cohesion funds in the three countries of Pannonian basin in the format of documentary films comes only as something reasonable and well-deliberated. A very powerful tool against any potential claims that such documentaries may serve only to support biased and overly positive-propagandistic views toward EU and its funds is compounding and intertwining not only one or two isolated cases but rather numerous and various proofs of all the benefits resulting from the project that were co-financed with the help of the Cohesion funds. Experts’ survey based on pure economic parameters measuring the effectiveness and social-benefits of the spent EU Cohesion funds in these three countries (Croatia, Hungary and Slovenia) will serve as an affirmation of our claim written down in the first sentence. The common denominative extrapolated from these facts – EU Cohesion funds have brought many benefits to the citizens of the EU - will be presented to the general audience of a few million viewers in a series of carefully scripted documentaries.

projects.TITLE: Dynamic and interactive and platform for citizens' involvement in European policies
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
DYNAMIC aims to implement a new format for spreading information on Cohesion Policies thorough an innovative format of active engagement of local communities. Co-planning will be our mean to generate a bottom-up virtuous automatic circle between exigence of being informed and information generation on impact of Cohesion Policies on local communities. Furthermore, we aim to involve equally and actively all parts of society, from Public Administrations, to private companies, from civil society actors, to private citizens. 
We will act with a bottom-up approach, beginning with small municipalities, which are the vast majority in Italy, and thanks to our iper-specialised network we plan to spread the experience to the entire regional territory, and nationally wide after project ending.
DYNAMIC puts into good use past H2020 Coesify and Perceive experience, data and recommendations and National Agency of Territorial Cohesion survey on degree of knowledge of Cohesion Policies results, in order to build on solid bases new, innovative and lasting solution, exportable not only in Other Italian Regions, but in most of other EU territories.
Keywords: Cohesion Information Bottom-Up Innovative Digital Green Inclusive

projects.TITLE: Everyday Cohesion: Communicating the Cohesion Report to citizens
projects.Funded under: Information Measures for the EU Cohesion policy (IMREG)
projects.Objective:
EVERYDAY COHESION: Communicating the Cohesion Report to citizens is a project proposed by European House.
In a rapidly changing world, under the current uncertain conditions Cohesion policy is and remains one of the cornerstones of EU policy-making. Its success is key to implement EU’s political priorities .

From a public perspective Cohesion policy is an area where the EU’s impact on daily life of millions of citizens can be manifested and measured. This is especially true in case of those who live in rural or remote areas.

The basic objective of our project is significantly increase citizens’-centred cohesion media coverage using local and regional communication channels assisted by the use of the 8th Report on Economic, Social and Territorial Cohesion of the European Commission released in March 2022.

The project involves nine EU regions, carefully selected based on development categories of the 8th Cohesion Report. Our target group is primarily composed of practising journalists working for local and regional media in 4 net contributing (DK, DE, IT and NL) and 5 Cohesion Fund net beneficiary countries (BG, HU, HR, RO and SK). The two Cohesion Field Visits together with participation at the EWRC will furnish them with the necessary knowledge and information to be effective “ambassadors” of Cohesion policy on local and regional levels. The ultimate result of the project is a significantly increased media coverage on Cohesion policy issues what would enhance public awareness of the results in this important EU policy field. The whole process is based on a changed mentality and perception of local journalists towards Cohesion policy issues.

The outreach of the project is realistic: the number of directly involved citizens with special emphasis on youth is 1.750; the indirectly involved persons are around 5.200. The project will generate 45 appearances in local media. The project duration is 12 months.

Deliverables.title: Final publication
Deliverables.description: A concluding printed and digital publication will analyse and summarise the results of the project activities with special emphasis on how to raise public awareness towards a citizens’ centered Cohesion policy practice. The publication will be broadly distributed among others at the EWRC2024.

Deliverables.title: Project video
Deliverables.description: On the basis of the experience gained and the lessons learned elements of the two Cohesion Field Visits a 5-minute video is produced with a special emphasis on citizens’ perceptions on Cohesion policy in practice. The video will be online (youtube) and advertised through social media channels.

Deliverables.title: Cohesion Field Visit 1
Deliverables.description: 10-day field visits with the participation of 10 journalists to check the local reality and project supported by Cohesion Funds. Journalists will meet local citizens in public places to collect their opinions/testimonies. Journalist will come from DE, DK, IT and NL. Journalist will visit the following net beneficiary Member States: BG, HU, HR, RO, SK

Deliverables.title: Cohesion Field Visit 2
Deliverables.description: 10-day field visits with the participation of 10 journalists to check the local reality and project supported by Cohesion Funds. Journalists will meet local citizens in public places to collect their opinions/testimonies. Journalist will come from BG, HU, HR, RO, SK. Journalist will visit the following net contributor Member States: DE, DK, IT and NL.

Deliverables.title: Kick off event
Deliverables.description: A project kick-off event will be organised during the Europe, let's cooperate interregional cooperation forum on 20-21 March 2024. The event will take place in Antwerp, Belgium. Two participants per project countries will travel to the kick-off event to finalise the programmes of Cohesion Field Visits.

Deliverables.title: Project website
Deliverables.description: The website is the one-stop-shop of project information with regular updates on implementation. Participants of the Cohesion Field Visits will share their impressions and experiences using the website together with the interviews they make with local decision-makers and ordinary citizens. Cohesion policy-related information is available against the backdrop of the 8th Cohesion Report. The website will contain among others a set of useful links and info on Cohesion Funds supported projects in the regions of the 9 visited countries.

Deliverables.title: Infographics
Deliverables.description: Using the 8th Cohesion Report as a background document attractive, easy-to-read papers will be produced in the local languages to assist communication with local citizens. The topics include the European Green Deal, social and inclusive Europe, women and youth, connectivity, corruption and specific information on the given region. 12 different type of infographics will be produced based on the 8th Cohesion Report in 9 project country languages + EN

Deliverables.title: Closing event
Deliverables.description: To present project results a side event will be held in Brussels with the participation of journalists of the Cohesion Field Visits.
